content: 1 There was a man in the land of Uz named Job. That man was blameless and upright; he feared God and shunned evil.
content_old: 1 There was a man in the land of Uz named Job. That man was blameless and upright; he feared God and shunned evil.

content: 2 Seven sons and three daughters were born to him;
content_old: 2 Seven sons and three daughters were born to him;

content: 3 his possessions were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen and five hundred she-asses, and a very large household. That man was wealthier than anyone in the East.
content_old: 3 his possessions were seven thousand sheep, three thousand camels, five hundred yoke of oxen and five hundred she-asses, and a very large household. That man was wealthier than anyone in the East.

content: 4 It was the custom of his sons to hold feasts, each on his set day in his own home. They would invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.
content_old: 4 It was the custom of his sons to hold feasts, each on his set day in his own home. They would invite their three sisters to eat and drink with them.

content: 5 When a round of feast days was over, Job would send word to them to sanctify themselves, and, rising early in the morning, he would make burnt offerings, one for each of them; for Job thought, “Perhaps my children have sinned and blasphemed God in their thoughts.” This is what Job always used to do.
content_old: 5 When a round of feast days was over, Job would send word to them to sanctify themselves, and, rising early in the morning, he would make burnt offerings, one for each of them; for Job thought, “Perhaps my children have sinned and blasphemed God in their thoughts.” This is what Job always used to do.

content: 6 One day the divine beings presented themselves before the LORD, and the Adversary came along with them.
content_old: 6 One day the divine beings presented themselves before the LORD, and the Adversary came along with them.

content: 7 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Where have you been?” The Adversary answered the LORD, “I have been roaming all over the earth.”
content_old: 7 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Where have you been?” The Adversary answered the LORD, “I have been roaming all over the earth.”

content: 8 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Have you noticed My servant Job? There is no one like him on earth, a blameless and upright man who fears God and shuns evil!”
content_old: 8 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Have you noticed My servant Job? There is no one like him on earth, a blameless and upright man who fears God and shuns evil!”

content: 9 The Adversary answered the LORD, “Does Job not have good reason to fear God?
content_old: 9 The Adversary answered the LORD, “Does Job not have good reason to fear God?

content: 10 Why, it is You who have fenced him round, him and his household and all that he has. You have blessed his efforts so that his possessions spread out in the land.
content_old: 10 Why, it is You who have fenced him round, him and his household and all that he has. You have blessed his efforts so that his possessions spread out in the land.

content: 11 But lay Your hand upon all that he has and he will surely blaspheme You to Your face.”
content_old: 11 But lay Your hand upon all that he has and he will surely blaspheme You to Your face.”

content: 12 The LORD replied to the Adversary, “See, all that he has is in your power; only do not lay a hand on him.” The Adversary departed from the presence of the LORD.
content_old: 12 The LORD replied to the Adversary, “See, all that he has is in your power; only do not lay a hand on him.” The Adversary departed from the presence of the LORD.

content: 13 One day, as his sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother,
content_old: 13 One day, as his sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother,

content: 14 a messenger came to Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the she-asses were grazing alongside them
content_old: 14 a messenger came to Job and said, “The oxen were plowing and the she-asses were grazing alongside them

content: 15 when Sabeans attacked them and carried them off, and put the boys to the sword; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
content_old: 15 when Sabeans attacked them and carried them off, and put the boys to the sword; I alone have escaped to tell you.”

content: 16 This one was still speaking when another came and said, “God’s fire fell from heaven, took hold of the sheep and the boys, and burned them up; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
content_old: 16 This one was still speaking when another came and said, “God’s fire fell from heaven, took hold of the sheep and the boys, and burned them up; I alone have escaped to tell you.”

content: 17 This one was still speaking when another came and said, “A Chaldean formation of three columns made a raid on the camels and carried them off and put the boys to the sword; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
content_old: 17 This one was still speaking when another came and said, “A Chaldean formation of three columns made a raid on the camels and carried them off and put the boys to the sword; I alone have escaped to tell you.”

content: 18 This one was still speaking when another came and said, “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother
content_old: 18 This one was still speaking when another came and said, “Your sons and daughters were eating and drinking wine in the house of their eldest brother

content: 19 when suddenly a mighty wind came from the wilderness. It struck the four corners of the house so that it collapsed upon the young people and they died; I alone have escaped to tell you.”
content_old: 19 when suddenly a mighty wind came from the wilderness. It struck the four corners of the house so that it collapsed upon the young people and they died; I alone have escaped to tell you.”

content: 20 Then Job arose, tore his robe, cut off his hair, and threw himself on the ground and worshiped.
content_old: 20 Then Job arose, tore his robe, cut off his hair, and threw himself on the ground and worshiped.

content: 21 He said, “Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return there; the LORD has given, and the LORD has taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.”
content_old: 21 He said, “Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return there; the LORD has given, and the LORD has taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.”

content: 1 One day the divine beings presented themselves before the LORD. The Adversary came along with them to present himself before the LORD.
content_old: 1 One day the divine beings presented themselves before the LORD. The Adversary came along with them to present himself before the LORD.

content: 2 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Where have you been?” The Adversary answered the LORD, “I have been roaming all over the earth.”
content_old: 2 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Where have you been?” The Adversary answered the LORD, “I have been roaming all over the earth.”

content: 3 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Have you noticed My servant Job? There is no one like him on earth, a blameless and upright man who fears God and shuns evil. He still keeps his integrity; so you have incited Me against him to destroy him for no good reason.”
content_old: 3 The LORD said to the Adversary, “Have you noticed My servant Job? There is no one like him on earth, a blameless and upright man who fears God and shuns evil. He still keeps his integrity; so you have incited Me against him to destroy him for no good reason.”

content: 4 The Adversary answered the LORD, “Skin for skin—all that a man has he will give up for his life.
content_old: 4 The Adversary answered the LORD, “Skin for skin—all that a man has he will give up for his life.

content: 5 But lay a hand on his bones and his flesh, and he will surely blaspheme You to Your face.”
content_old: 5 But lay a hand on his bones and his flesh, and he will surely blaspheme You to Your face.”

content: 6 So the LORD said to the Adversary, “See, he is in your power; only spare his life.”
content_old: 6 So the LORD said to the Adversary, “See, he is in your power; only spare his life.”

content: 7 The Adversary departed from the presence of the LORD and inflicted a severe inflammation on Job from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head.
content_old: 7 The Adversary departed from the presence of the LORD and inflicted a severe inflammation on Job from the sole of his foot to the crown of his head.

content: 8 He took a potsherd to scratch himself as he sat in ashes.
content_old: 8 He took a potsherd to scratch himself as he sat in ashes.

content: 9 His wife said to him, “You still keep your integrity! Blaspheme God and die!”
content_old: 9 His wife said to him, “You still keep your integrity! Blaspheme God and die!”

content: 10 But he said to her, “You talk as any shameless woman might talk! Should we accept only good from God and not accept evil?” For all that, Job said nothing sinful.
content_old: 10 But he said to her, “You talk as any shameless woman might talk! Should we accept only good from God and not accept evil?” For all that, Job said nothing sinful.

content: 11 When Job’s three friends heard about all these calamities that had befallen him, each came from his home—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They met together to go and console and comfort him.
content_old: 11 When Job’s three friends heard about all these calamities that had befallen him, each came from his home—Eliphaz the Temanite, Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite. They met together to go and console and comfort him.

content: 12 When they saw him from a distance, they could not recognize him, and they broke into loud weeping; each one tore his robe and threw dust into the air onto his head.
content_old: 12 When they saw him from a distance, they could not recognize him, and they broke into loud weeping; each one tore his robe and threw dust into the air onto his head.

content: 1 Afterward, Job began to speak and cursed the day of his birth.
content_old: 1 Afterward, Job began to speak and cursed the day of his birth.

content: 2 Job spoke up and said:
content_old: 2 Job spoke up and said:

content: 3 Perish the day on which I was born, And the night it was announced, “A male has been conceived!”
content_old: 3 Perish the day on which I was born, And the night it was announced, “A male has been conceived!”

content: 4 May that day be darkness; May God above have no concern for it; May light not shine on it;
content_old: 4 May that day be darkness; May God above have no concern for it; May light not shine on it;

content: 5 May darkness and deep gloom reclaim it; May a pall lie over it; May what blackens the day terrify it.
content_old: 5 May darkness and deep gloom reclaim it; May a pall lie over it; May what blackens the day terrify it.

content: 6 May obscurity carry off that night; May it not be counted among the days of the year; May it not appear in any of its months;
content_old: 6 May obscurity carry off that night; May it not be counted among the days of the year; May it not appear in any of its months;

content: 7 May that night be desolate; May no sound of joy be heard in it;
content_old: 7 May that night be desolate; May no sound of joy be heard in it;

content: 8 May those who cast spells upon the day damn it, Those prepared to disable Leviathan;
content_old: 8 May those who cast spells upon the day damn it, Those prepared to disable Leviathan;

content: 9 May its twilight stars remain dark; May it hope for light and have none; May it not see the glimmerings of the dawn—
content_old: 9 May its twilight stars remain dark; May it hope for light and have none; May it not see the glimmerings of the dawn—

content: 10 Because it did not block my mother’s womb, And hide trouble from my eyes.
content_old: 10 Because it did not block my mother’s womb, And hide trouble from my eyes.

content: 11 Why did I not die at birth, Expire as I came forth from the womb?
content_old: 11 Why did I not die at birth, Expire as I came forth from the womb?

content: 12 Why were there knees to receive me, Or breasts for me to suck?
content_old: 12 Why were there knees to receive me, Or breasts for me to suck?

content: 13 For now would I be lying in repose, asleep and at rest,
content_old: 13 For now would I be lying in repose, asleep and at rest,

content: 14 With the world’s kings and counselors who rebuild ruins for themselves,
content_old: 14 With the world’s kings and counselors who rebuild ruins for themselves,

content: 15 Or with nobles who possess gold and who fill their houses with silver.
content_old: 15 Or with nobles who possess gold and who fill their houses with silver.

content: 16 Or why was I not like a buried stillbirth, Like babies who never saw the light?
content_old: 16 Or why was I not like a buried stillbirth, Like babies who never saw the light?

content: 17 There the wicked cease from troubling; There rest those whose strength is spent.
content_old: 17 There the wicked cease from troubling; There rest those whose strength is spent.

content: 18 Prisoners are wholly at ease; They do not hear the taskmaster’s voice.
content_old: 18 Prisoners are wholly at ease; They do not hear the taskmaster’s voice.

content: 19 Small and great alike are there, And the slave is free of his master.
content_old: 19 Small and great alike are there, And the slave is free of his master.

content: 20 Why does He give light to the sufferer And life to the bitter in spirit;
content_old: 20 Why does He give light to the sufferer And life to the bitter in spirit;

content: 21 To those who wait for death but it does not come, Who search for it more than for treasure,
content_old: 21 To those who wait for death but it does not come, Who search for it more than for treasure,

content: 22 Who rejoice to exultation, And are glad to reach the grave;
content_old: 22 Who rejoice to exultation, And are glad to reach the grave;

content: 23 To the man who has lost his way, Whom God has hedged about?
content_old: 23 To the man who has lost his way, Whom God has hedged about?

content: 24 My groaning serves as my bread; My roaring pours forth as water.
content_old: 24 My groaning serves as my bread; My roaring pours forth as water.

content: 25 For what I feared has overtaken me; What I dreaded has come upon me.
content_old: 25 For what I feared has overtaken me; What I dreaded has come upon me.

content: 1 Then Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
content_old: 1 Then Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:

content: 2 If one ventures a word with you, will it be too much? But who can hold back his words?
content_old: 2 If one ventures a word with you, will it be too much? But who can hold back his words?

content: 3 See, you have encouraged many; You have strengthened failing hands.
content_old: 3 See, you have encouraged many; You have strengthened failing hands.

content: 4 Your words have kept him who stumbled from falling; You have braced knees that gave way.
content_old: 4 Your words have kept him who stumbled from falling; You have braced knees that gave way.

content: 5 But now that it overtakes you, it is too much; It reaches you, and you are unnerved.
content_old: 5 But now that it overtakes you, it is too much; It reaches you, and you are unnerved.

content: 6 Is not your piety your confidence, Your integrity your hope?
content_old: 6 Is not your piety your confidence, Your integrity your hope?

content: 7 Think now, what innocent man ever perished? Where have the upright been destroyed?
content_old: 7 Think now, what innocent man ever perished? Where have the upright been destroyed?

content: 8 As I have seen, those who plow evil And sow mischief reap them.
content_old: 8 As I have seen, those who plow evil And sow mischief reap them.

content: 9 They perish by a blast from God, Are gone at the breath of His nostrils.
content_old: 9 They perish by a blast from God, Are gone at the breath of His nostrils.

content: 10 The lion may roar, the cub may howl, But the teeth of the king of beasts are broken.
content_old: 10 The lion may roar, the cub may howl, But the teeth of the king of beasts are broken.

content: 11 The lion perishes for lack of prey, And its whelps are scattered.
content_old: 11 The lion perishes for lack of prey, And its whelps are scattered.

content: 12 A word came to me in stealth; My ear caught a whisper of it.
content_old: 12 A word came to me in stealth; My ear caught a whisper of it.

content: 13 In thought-filled visions of the night, When deep sleep falls on men,
content_old: 13 In thought-filled visions of the night, When deep sleep falls on men,

content: 14 Fear and trembling came upon me, Causing all my bones to quake with fright.
content_old: 14 Fear and trembling came upon me, Causing all my bones to quake with fright.

content: 15 A wind passed by me, Making the hair of my flesh bristle.
content_old: 15 A wind passed by me, Making the hair of my flesh bristle.

content: 16 It halted; its appearance was strange to me; A form loomed before my eyes; I heard a murmur, a voice,
content_old: 16 It halted; its appearance was strange to me; A form loomed before my eyes; I heard a murmur, a voice,

content: 17 “Can mortals be acquitted by God? Can man be cleared by his Maker?
content_old: 17 “Can mortals be acquitted by God? Can man be cleared by his Maker?

content: 18 If He cannot trust His own servants, And casts reproach on His angels,
content_old: 18 If He cannot trust His own servants, And casts reproach on His angels,

content: 19 How much less those who dwell in houses of clay, Whose origin is dust, Who are crushed like the moth,
content_old: 19 How much less those who dwell in houses of clay, Whose origin is dust, Who are crushed like the moth,

content: 20 Shattered between daybreak and evening, Perishing forever, unnoticed.
content_old: 20 Shattered between daybreak and evening, Perishing forever, unnoticed.

content: 1 Call now! Will anyone answer you? To whom among the holy beings will you turn?
content_old: 1 Call now! Will anyone answer you? To whom among the holy beings will you turn?

content: 2 Vexation kills the fool; Passion slays the simpleton.
content_old: 2 Vexation kills the fool; Passion slays the simpleton.

content: 3 I myself saw a fool who had struck roots; Impulsively, I cursed his home:
content_old: 3 I myself saw a fool who had struck roots; Impulsively, I cursed his home:

content: 4 May his children be far from success; May they be oppressed in the gate with none to deliver them;
content_old: 4 May his children be far from success; May they be oppressed in the gate with none to deliver them;

content: 5 May the hungry devour his harvest, Carrying it off in baskets; May the thirsty swallow their wealth.
content_old: 5 May the hungry devour his harvest, Carrying it off in baskets; May the thirsty swallow their wealth.

content: 6 Evil does not grow out of the soil, Nor does mischief spring from the ground;
content_old: 6 Evil does not grow out of the soil, Nor does mischief spring from the ground;

content: 7 For man is born to mischief, Just as sparks fly upward.
content_old: 7 For man is born to mischief, Just as sparks fly upward.

content: 8 But I would resort to God; I would lay my case before God,
content_old: 8 But I would resort to God; I would lay my case before God,

content: 9 Who performs great deeds which cannot be fathomed, Wondrous things without number;
content_old: 9 Who performs great deeds which cannot be fathomed, Wondrous things without number;

content: 10 Who gives rain to the earth, And sends water over the fields;
content_old: 10 Who gives rain to the earth, And sends water over the fields;

content: 11 Who raises the lowly up high, So that the dejected are secure in victory;
content_old: 11 Who raises the lowly up high, So that the dejected are secure in victory;

content: 12 Who thwarts the designs of the crafty, So that their hands cannot gain success;
content_old: 12 Who thwarts the designs of the crafty, So that their hands cannot gain success;

content: 13 Who traps the clever in their own wiles; The plans of the crafty go awry.
content_old: 13 Who traps the clever in their own wiles; The plans of the crafty go awry.

content: 14 By day they encounter darkness, At noon they grope as in the night.
content_old: 14 By day they encounter darkness, At noon they grope as in the night.

content: 15 But He saves the needy from the sword of their mouth, From the clutches of the strong.
content_old: 15 But He saves the needy from the sword of their mouth, From the clutches of the strong.

content: 16 So there is hope for the wretched; The mouth of wrongdoing is stopped.
content_old: 16 So there is hope for the wretched; The mouth of wrongdoing is stopped.

content: 17 See how happy is the man whom God reproves; Do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.
content_old: 17 See how happy is the man whom God reproves; Do not reject the discipline of the Almighty.

content: 18 He injures, but He binds up; He wounds, but His hands heal.
content_old: 18 He injures, but He binds up; He wounds, but His hands heal.

content: 19 He will deliver you from six troubles; In seven no harm will reach you:
content_old: 19 He will deliver you from six troubles; In seven no harm will reach you:

content: 20 In famine He will redeem you from death, In war, from the sword.
content_old: 20 In famine He will redeem you from death, In war, from the sword.

content: 21 You will be sheltered from the scourging tongue; You will have no fear when violence comes.
content_old: 21 You will be sheltered from the scourging tongue; You will have no fear when violence comes.

content: 22 You will laugh at violence and starvation, And have no fear of wild beasts.
content_old: 22 You will laugh at violence and starvation, And have no fear of wild beasts.

content: 23 For you will have a pact with the rocks in the field, And the beasts of the field will be your allies.
content_old: 23 For you will have a pact with the rocks in the field, And the beasts of the field will be your allies.

content: 24 You will know that all is well in your tent; When you visit your wife you will never fail.
content_old: 24 You will know that all is well in your tent; When you visit your wife you will never fail.

content: 25 You will see that your offspring are many, Your descendants like the grass of the earth.
content_old: 25 You will see that your offspring are many, Your descendants like the grass of the earth.

content: 26 You will come to the grave in ripe old age, As shocks of grain are taken away in their season.
content_old: 26 You will come to the grave in ripe old age, As shocks of grain are taken away in their season.

content: 1 Then Job said in reply:
content_old: 1 Then Job said in reply:

content: 2 If my anguish were weighed, My full calamity laid on the scales,
content_old: 2 If my anguish were weighed, My full calamity laid on the scales,

content: 3 It would be heavier than the sand of the sea; That is why I spoke recklessly.
content_old: 3 It would be heavier than the sand of the sea; That is why I spoke recklessly.

content: 4 For the arrows of the Almighty are in me; My spirit absorbs their poison; God’s terrors are arrayed against me.
content_old: 4 For the arrows of the Almighty are in me; My spirit absorbs their poison; God’s terrors are arrayed against me.

content: 5 Does a wild ass bray when he has grass? Does a bull bellow over his fodder?
content_old: 5 Does a wild ass bray when he has grass? Does a bull bellow over his fodder?

content: 6 Can what is tasteless be eaten without salt? Does mallow juice have any flavor?
content_old: 6 Can what is tasteless be eaten without salt? Does mallow juice have any flavor?

content: 7 I refuse to touch them; They are like food when I am sick.
content_old: 7 I refuse to touch them; They are like food when I am sick.

content: 8 Would that my request were granted, That God gave me what I wished for;
content_old: 8 Would that my request were granted, That God gave me what I wished for;

content: 9 Would that God consented to crush me, Loosed His hand and cut me off.
content_old: 9 Would that God consented to crush me, Loosed His hand and cut me off.

content: 10 Then this would be my consolation, As I writhed in unsparing pains: That I did not suppress my words against the Holy One.
content_old: 10 Then this would be my consolation, As I writhed in unsparing pains: That I did not suppress my words against the Holy One.

content: 11 What strength have I, that I should endure? How long have I to live, that I should be patient?
content_old: 11 What strength have I, that I should endure? How long have I to live, that I should be patient?

content: 12 Is my strength the strength of rock? Is my flesh bronze?
content_old: 12 Is my strength the strength of rock? Is my flesh bronze?

content: 13 Truly, I cannot help myself; I have been deprived of resourcefulness.
content_old: 13 Truly, I cannot help myself; I have been deprived of resourcefulness.

content: 14 A friend owes loyalty to one who fails, Though he forsakes the fear of the Almighty;
content_old: 14 A friend owes loyalty to one who fails, Though he forsakes the fear of the Almighty;

content: 15 My comrades are fickle, like a wadi, Like a bed on which streams once ran.
content_old: 15 My comrades are fickle, like a wadi, Like a bed on which streams once ran.

content: 16 They are dark with ice; Snow obscures them;
content_old: 16 They are dark with ice; Snow obscures them;

content: 17 But when they thaw, they vanish; In the heat, they disappear where they are.
content_old: 17 But when they thaw, they vanish; In the heat, they disappear where they are.

content: 18 Their course twists and turns; They run into the desert and perish.
content_old: 18 Their course twists and turns; They run into the desert and perish.

content: 19 Caravans from Tema look to them; Processions from Sheba count on them.
content_old: 19 Caravans from Tema look to them; Processions from Sheba count on them.

content: 20 They are disappointed in their hopes; When they reach the place, they stand aghast.
content_old: 20 They are disappointed in their hopes; When they reach the place, they stand aghast.

content: 21 So you are as nothing: At the sight of misfortune, you take fright.
content_old: 21 So you are as nothing: At the sight of misfortune, you take fright.

content: 22 Did I say to you, “I need your gift; Pay a bribe for me out of your wealth;
content_old: 22 Did I say to you, “I need your gift; Pay a bribe for me out of your wealth;

content: 23 Deliver me from the clutches of my enemy; Redeem me from violent men”?
content_old: 23 Deliver me from the clutches of my enemy; Redeem me from violent men”?

content: 24 Teach me; I shall be silent; Tell me where I am wrong.
content_old: 24 Teach me; I shall be silent; Tell me where I am wrong.

content: 25 How trenchant honest words are; But what sort of reproof comes from you?
content_old: 25 How trenchant honest words are; But what sort of reproof comes from you?

content: 26 Do you devise words of reproof, But count a hopeless man’s words as wind?
content_old: 26 Do you devise words of reproof, But count a hopeless man’s words as wind?

content: 27 You would even cast lots over an orphan, Or barter away your friend.
content_old: 27 You would even cast lots over an orphan, Or barter away your friend.

content: 28 Now be so good as to face me; I will not lie to your face.
content_old: 28 Now be so good as to face me; I will not lie to your face.

content: 29 Relent! Let there not be injustice; Relent! I am still in the right.
content_old: 29 Relent! Let there not be injustice; Relent! I am still in the right.

content: 1 Truly man has a term of service on earth; His days are like those of a hireling—
content_old: 1 Truly man has a term of service on earth; His days are like those of a hireling—

content: 2 Like a slave who longs for shadows, Like a hireling who waits for his wage.
content_old: 2 Like a slave who longs for shadows, Like a hireling who waits for his wage.

content: 3 So have I been allotted months of futility; Nights of misery have been apportioned to me.
content_old: 3 So have I been allotted months of futility; Nights of misery have been apportioned to me.

content: 4 When I lie down, I think, “When shall I rise?” Night drags on, And I am sated with tossings till morning twilight.
content_old: 4 When I lie down, I think, “When shall I rise?” Night drags on, And I am sated with tossings till morning twilight.

content: 5 My flesh is covered with maggots and clods of earth; My skin is broken and festering.
content_old: 5 My flesh is covered with maggots and clods of earth; My skin is broken and festering.

content: 6 My days fly faster than a weaver’s shuttle, And come to their end without hope.
content_old: 6 My days fly faster than a weaver’s shuttle, And come to their end without hope.

content: 7 Consider that my life is but wind; I shall never see happiness again.
content_old: 7 Consider that my life is but wind; I shall never see happiness again.

content: 8 The eye that gazes on me will not see me; Your eye will seek me, but I shall be gone.
content_old: 8 The eye that gazes on me will not see me; Your eye will seek me, but I shall be gone.

content: 9 As a cloud fades away, So whoever goes down to Sheol does not come up;
content_old: 9 As a cloud fades away, So whoever goes down to Sheol does not come up;

content: 10 He returns no more to his home; His place does not know him.
content_old: 10 He returns no more to his home; His place does not know him.

content: 11 On my part, I will not speak with restraint; I will give voice to the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
content_old: 11 On my part, I will not speak with restraint; I will give voice to the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.

content: 12 Am I the sea or the Dragon, That You have set a watch over me?
content_old: 12 Am I the sea or the Dragon, That You have set a watch over me?

content: 13 When I think, “My bed will comfort me, My couch will share my sorrow,”
content_old: 13 When I think, “My bed will comfort me, My couch will share my sorrow,”

content: 14 You frighten me with dreams, And terrify me with visions,

content: 16 Then You would not count my steps, Or keep watch over my sin.
content_old: 16 Then You would not count my steps, Or keep watch over my sin.

content: 17 My transgression would be sealed up in a pouch; You would coat over my iniquity.
content_old: 17 My transgression would be sealed up in a pouch; You would coat over my iniquity.

content: 18 Mountains collapse and crumble; Rocks are dislodged from their place.
content_old: 18 Mountains collapse and crumble; Rocks are dislodged from their place.

content: 19 Water wears away stone; Torrents wash away earth; So you destroy man’s hope,
content_old: 19 Water wears away stone; Torrents wash away earth; So you destroy man’s hope,

content: 20 You overpower him forever and he perishes; You alter his visage and dispatch him.
content_old: 20 You overpower him forever and he perishes; You alter his visage and dispatch him.

content: 21 His sons attain honor and he does not know it; They are humbled and he is not aware of it.

content: 1 Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
content_old: 1 Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:

content: 2 Does a wise man answer with windy opinions, And fill his belly with the east wind?
content_old: 2 Does a wise man answer with windy opinions, And fill his belly with the east wind?

content: 3 Should he argue with useless talk, With words that are of no worth?
content_old: 3 Should he argue with useless talk, With words that are of no worth?

content: 4 You subvert piety And restrain prayer to God.
content_old: 4 You subvert piety And restrain prayer to God.

content: 5 Your sinfulness dictates your speech, So you choose crafty language.
content_old: 5 Your sinfulness dictates your speech, So you choose crafty language.

content: 6 Your own mouth condemns you—not I; Your lips testify against you.
content_old: 6 Your own mouth condemns you—not I; Your lips testify against you.

content: 7 Were you the first man born? Were you created before the hills?
content_old: 7 Were you the first man born? Were you created before the hills?

content: 8 Have you listened in on the council of God? Have you sole possession of wisdom?
content_old: 8 Have you listened in on the council of God? Have you sole possession of wisdom?

content: 9 What do you know that we do not know, Or understand that we do not?
content_old: 9 What do you know that we do not know, Or understand that we do not?

content: 10 Among us are gray-haired old men, Older by far than your father.
content_old: 10 Among us are gray-haired old men, Older by far than your father.

content: 11 Are God’s consolations not enough for you, And His gentle words to you?
content_old: 11 Are God’s consolations not enough for you, And His gentle words to you?

content: 12 How your heart has carried you away, How your eyes have failed you,
content_old: 12 How your heart has carried you away, How your eyes have failed you,

content: 13 That you could vent your anger on God, And let such words out of your mouth!
content_old: 13 That you could vent your anger on God, And let such words out of your mouth!

content: 14 What is man that he can be cleared of guilt, One born of woman, that he be in the right?
content_old: 14 What is man that he can be cleared of guilt, One born of woman, that he be in the right?

content: 15 He puts no trust in His holy ones; The heavens are not guiltless in His sight;
content_old: 15 He puts no trust in His holy ones; The heavens are not guiltless in His sight;

content: 16 What then of one loathsome and foul, Man, who drinks wrongdoing like water!
content_old: 16 What then of one loathsome and foul, Man, who drinks wrongdoing like water!

content: 17 I will hold forth; listen to me; What I have seen, I will declare—
content_old: 17 I will hold forth; listen to me; What I have seen, I will declare—

content: 18 That which wise men have transmitted from their fathers, And have not withheld,
content_old: 18 That which wise men have transmitted from their fathers, And have not withheld,

content: 19 To whom alone the land was given, No stranger passing among them:
content_old: 19 To whom alone the land was given, No stranger passing among them:

content: 20 The wicked man writhes in torment all his days; Few years are reserved for the ruthless.
content_old: 20 The wicked man writhes in torment all his days; Few years are reserved for the ruthless.

content: 21 Frightening sounds fill his ears; When he is at ease a robber falls upon him.
content_old: 21 Frightening sounds fill his ears; When he is at ease a robber falls upon him.

content: 22 He is never sure he will come back from the dark; A sword stares him in the face.
content_old: 22 He is never sure he will come back from the dark; A sword stares him in the face.

content: 23 He wanders about for bread—where is it? He knows that the day of darkness has been readied for him.
content_old: 23 He wanders about for bread—where is it? He knows that the day of darkness has been readied for him.

content: 24 Troubles terrify him, anxiety overpowers him, Like a king expecting a siege.
content_old: 24 Troubles terrify him, anxiety overpowers him, Like a king expecting a siege.

content: 25 For he has raised his arm against God And played the hero against the Almighty.
content_old: 25 For he has raised his arm against God And played the hero against the Almighty.

content: 26 He runs at Him defiantly With his thickly bossed shield.
content_old: 26 He runs at Him defiantly With his thickly bossed shield.

content: 27 His face is covered with fat And his loins with blubber.
content_old: 27 His face is covered with fat And his loins with blubber.

content: 28 He dwells in cities doomed to ruin, In houses that shall not be lived in, That are destined to become heaps of rubble.
content_old: 28 He dwells in cities doomed to ruin, In houses that shall not be lived in, That are destined to become heaps of rubble.

content: 29 He will not be rich; His wealth will not endure; His produce shall not bend to the earth.
content_old: 29 He will not be rich; His wealth will not endure; His produce shall not bend to the earth.

content: 30 He will never get away from the darkness; Flames will sear his shoots; He will pass away by the breath of His mouth.
content_old: 30 He will never get away from the darkness; Flames will sear his shoots; He will pass away by the breath of His mouth.

content: 31 He will not be trusted; He will be misled by falsehood, And falsehood will be his recompense.
content_old: 31 He will not be trusted; He will be misled by falsehood, And falsehood will be his recompense.

content: 32 He will wither before his time, His boughs never having flourished.
content_old: 32 He will wither before his time, His boughs never having flourished.

content: 33 He will drop his unripe grapes like a vine; He will shed his blossoms like an olive tree.
content_old: 33 He will drop his unripe grapes like a vine; He will shed his blossoms like an olive tree.

content: 34 For the company of the impious is desolate; Fire consumes the tents of the briber;

content: 1 Job said in reply:
content_old: 1 Job said in reply:

content: 2 I have often heard such things; You are all mischievous comforters.
content_old: 2 I have often heard such things; You are all mischievous comforters.

content: 3 Have windy words no limit? What afflicts you that you speak on?
content_old: 3 Have windy words no limit? What afflicts you that you speak on?

content: 4 I would also talk like you If you were in my place; I would barrage you with words, I would wag my head over you.
content_old: 4 I would also talk like you If you were in my place; I would barrage you with words, I would wag my head over you.

content: 5 I would encourage you with words, My moving lips would bring relief.
content_old: 5 I would encourage you with words, My moving lips would bring relief.

content: 6 If I speak, my pain will not be relieved, And if I do not—what have I lost?
content_old: 6 If I speak, my pain will not be relieved, And if I do not—what have I lost?

content: 7 Now He has truly worn me out; You have destroyed my whole community.
content_old: 7 Now He has truly worn me out; You have destroyed my whole community.

content: 8 You have shriveled me; My gauntness serves as a witness, And testifies against me.
content_old: 8 You have shriveled me; My gauntness serves as a witness, And testifies against me.

content: 9 In His anger He tears and persecutes me; He gnashes His teeth at me; My foe stabs me with his eyes.
content_old: 9 In His anger He tears and persecutes me; He gnashes His teeth at me; My foe stabs me with his eyes.

content: 10 They open wide their mouths at me; Reviling me, they strike my cheeks; They inflame themselves against me.
content_old: 10 They open wide their mouths at me; Reviling me, they strike my cheeks; They inflame themselves against me.

content: 11 God hands me over to an evil man, Thrusts me into the clutches of the wicked.
content_old: 11 God hands me over to an evil man, Thrusts me into the clutches of the wicked.

content: 12 I had been untroubled, and He broke me in pieces; He took me by the scruff and shattered me; He set me up as His target;
content_old: 12 I had been untroubled, and He broke me in pieces; He took me by the scruff and shattered me; He set me up as His target;

content: 13 His bowmen surrounded me; He pierced my kidneys; He showed no mercy; He spilled my bile onto the ground.
content_old: 13 His bowmen surrounded me; He pierced my kidneys; He showed no mercy; He spilled my bile onto the ground.

content: 14 He breached me, breach after breach; He rushed at me like a warrior.
content_old: 14 He breached me, breach after breach; He rushed at me like a warrior.

content: 15 I sewed sackcloth over my skin; I buried my glory in the dust.
content_old: 15 I sewed sackcloth over my skin; I buried my glory in the dust.

content: 16 My face is red with weeping; Darkness covers my eyes
content_old: 16 My face is red with weeping; Darkness covers my eyes

content: 17 For no injustice on my part And for the purity of my prayer!
content_old: 17 For no injustice on my part And for the purity of my prayer!

content: 18 Earth, do not cover my blood; Let there be no resting place for my outcry!
content_old: 18 Earth, do not cover my blood; Let there be no resting place for my outcry!

content: 19 Surely now my witness is in heaven; He who can testify for me is on high.
content_old: 19 Surely now my witness is in heaven; He who can testify for me is on high.

content: 20 O my advocates, my fellows, Before God my eyes shed tears;
content_old: 20 O my advocates, my fellows, Before God my eyes shed tears;

content: 21 Let Him arbitrate between a man and God As between a man and his fellow.
content_old: 21 Let Him arbitrate between a man and God As between a man and his fellow.

content: 1 My spirit is crushed, my days run out; The graveyard waits for me.
content_old: 1 My spirit is crushed, my days run out; The graveyard waits for me.

content: 2 Surely mocking men keep me company, And with their provocations I close my eyes.
content_old: 2 Surely mocking men keep me company, And with their provocations I close my eyes.

content: 3 Come now, stand surety for me! Who will give his hand on my behalf?
content_old: 3 Come now, stand surety for me! Who will give his hand on my behalf?

content: 4 You have hidden understanding from their minds; Therefore You must not exalt them.
content_old: 4 You have hidden understanding from their minds; Therefore You must not exalt them.

content: 5 He informs on his friends for a share , And his children’s eyes pine away.
content_old: 5 He informs on his friends for a share , And his children’s eyes pine away.

content: 6 He made me a byword among people; I have become like Tophet of old.
content_old: 6 He made me a byword among people; I have become like Tophet of old.

content: 7 My eyes fail from vexation; All shapes seem to me like shadows.
content_old: 7 My eyes fail from vexation; All shapes seem to me like shadows.

content: 8 The upright are amazed at this; The pure are aroused against the impious.
content_old: 8 The upright are amazed at this; The pure are aroused against the impious.

content: 9 The righteous man holds to his way; He whose hands are clean grows stronger.
content_old: 9 The righteous man holds to his way; He whose hands are clean grows stronger.

content: 10 But all of you, come back now; I shall not find a wise man among you.
content_old: 10 But all of you, come back now; I shall not find a wise man among you.

content: 11 My days are done, my tendons severed, The strings of my heart.
content_old: 11 My days are done, my tendons severed, The strings of my heart.

content: 12 They say that night is day, That light is here—in the face of darkness.
content_old: 12 They say that night is day, That light is here—in the face of darkness.

content: 13 If I must look forward to Sheol as my home, And make my bed in the dark place,
content_old: 13 If I must look forward to Sheol as my home, And make my bed in the dark place,

content: 14 Say to the Pit, “You are my father,” To the maggots, “Mother,” “Sister”—
content_old: 14 Say to the Pit, “You are my father,” To the maggots, “Mother,” “Sister”—

content: 15 Where, then, is my hope? Who can see hope for me?
content_old: 15 Where, then, is my hope? Who can see hope for me?

content_old: 3 Why are we thought of as brutes, Regarded by you as stupid?

content_old: 4 You who tear yourself to pieces in anger— Will earth’s order be disrupted for your sake? Will rocks be dislodged from their place?

content: 5 Indeed, the light of the wicked fails; The flame of his fire does not shine.
content_old: 5 Indeed, the light of the wicked fails; The flame of his fire does not shine.

content: 6 The light in his tent darkens; His lamp fails him.

content_old: 8 He is led by his feet into the net; He walks onto the toils.

content: 9 The trap seizes his heel; The noose tightens on him.

content: 10 The rope for him lies hidden on the ground; His snare, on the path.
content_old: 10 The rope for him lies hidden on the ground; His snare, on the path.

content: 11 Terrors assault him on all sides And send his feet flying.
content_old: 11 Terrors assault him on all sides And send his feet flying.

content: 12 His progeny hunger; Disaster awaits his wife.
content_old: 12 His progeny hunger; Disaster awaits his wife.

content: 13 The tendons under his skin are consumed; Death’s first-born consumes his tendons.
content_old: 13 The tendons under his skin are consumed; Death’s first-born consumes his tendons.

content: 14 He is torn from the safety of his tent; Terror marches him to the king.
content_old: 14 He is torn from the safety of his tent; Terror marches him to the king.

content: 15 It lodges in his desolate tent; Sulfur is strewn upon his home.
content_old: 15 It lodges in his desolate tent; Sulfur is strewn upon his home.

content: 16 His roots below dry up, And above, his branches wither.
content_old: 16 His roots below dry up, And above, his branches wither.

content: 17 All mention of him vanishes from the earth; He has no name abroad.
content_old: 17 All mention of him vanishes from the earth; He has no name abroad.

content: 18 He is thrust from light to darkness, Driven from the world.
content_old: 18 He is thrust from light to darkness, Driven from the world.

content: 19 He has no seed or breed among his people, No survivor where he once lived.
content_old: 19 He has no seed or breed among his people, No survivor where he once lived.

content: 20 Generations to come will be appalled at his fate, As the previous ones are seized with horror.

content_old: 2 How long will you grieve my spirit, And crush me with words?

content_old: 3 Time and again you humiliate me, And are not ashamed to abuse me.

content: 4 If indeed I have erred, My error remains with me.
content_old: 4 If indeed I have erred, My error remains with me.

content_old: 5 Though you are overbearing toward me, Reproaching me with my disgrace,

content_old: 6 Yet know that God has wronged me; He has thrown up siege works around me.

content: 7 I cry, “Violence!” but am not answered; I shout, but can get no justice.
content_old: 7 I cry, “Violence!” but am not answered; I shout, but can get no justice.

content: 8 He has barred my way; I cannot pass; He has laid darkness upon my path.
content_old: 8 He has barred my way; I cannot pass; He has laid darkness upon my path.

content: 9 He has stripped me of my glory, Removed the crown from my head.
content_old: 9 He has stripped me of my glory, Removed the crown from my head.

content: 10 He tears down every part of me; I perish; He uproots my hope like a tree.
content_old: 10 He tears down every part of me; I perish; He uproots my hope like a tree.

content: 11 He kindles His anger against me; He regards me as one of His foes.
content_old: 11 He kindles His anger against me; He regards me as one of His foes.

content: 12 His troops advance together; They build their road toward me And encamp around my tent.
content_old: 12 His troops advance together; They build their road toward me And encamp around my tent.

content: 13 He alienated my kin from me; My acquaintances disown me.
content_old: 13 He alienated my kin from me; My acquaintances disown me.

content: 14 My relatives are gone; My friends have forgotten me.
content_old: 14 My relatives are gone; My friends have forgotten me.

content: 15 My dependents and maidservants regard me as a stranger; I am an outsider to them.
content_old: 15 My dependents and maidservants regard me as a stranger; I am an outsider to them.

content: 16 I summon my servant but he does not respond; I must myself entreat him.
content_old: 16 I summon my servant but he does not respond; I must myself entreat him.

content: 17 My odor is repulsive to my wife; I am loathsome to my children.
content_old: 17 My odor is repulsive to my wife; I am loathsome to my children.

content: 18 Even youngsters disdain me; When I rise, they speak against me.
content_old: 18 Even youngsters disdain me; When I rise, they speak against me.

content: 19 All my bosom friends detest me; Those I love have turned against me.
content_old: 19 All my bosom friends detest me; Those I love have turned against me.

content: 20 My bones stick to my skin and flesh; I escape with the skin of my teeth.
content_old: 20 My bones stick to my skin and flesh; I escape with the skin of my teeth.

content: 21 Pity me, pity me! You are my friends; For the hand of God has struck me!
content_old: 21 Pity me, pity me! You are my friends; For the hand of God has struck me!

content: 22 Why do you pursue me like God, Maligning me insatiably?
content_old: 22 Why do you pursue me like God, Maligning me insatiably?

content: 23 O that my words were written down; Would they were inscribed in a record,
content_old: 23 O that my words were written down; Would they were inscribed in a record,

content: 24 Incised on a rock forever With iron stylus and lead!
content_old: 24 Incised on a rock forever With iron stylus and lead!

content: 25 But I know that my Vindicator lives; In the end He will testify on earth—
content_old: 25 But I know that my Vindicator lives; In the end He will testify on earth—

content_old: 26 This, after my skin will have been peeled off. But I would behold God while still in my flesh,

content_old: 27 I myself, not another, would behold Him; Would see with my own eyes: My heart pines within me.

content_old: 3 When I hear reproof that insults me; A spirit out of my understanding makes me reply:

content_old: 4 Do you not know this, that from time immemorial, Since man was set on earth,

content: 5 The joy of the wicked has been brief, The happiness of the impious, fleeting?
content_old: 5 The joy of the wicked has been brief, The happiness of the impious, fleeting?

content: 6 Though he grows as high as the sky, His head reaching the clouds,
content_old: 6 Though he grows as high as the sky, His head reaching the clouds,

content_old: 7 He perishes forever, like his dung; Those who saw him will say, “Where is he?”

content_old: 9 Eyes that glimpsed him do so no more; They cannot see him in his place any longer.

content: 10 His sons ingratiate themselves with the poor; His own hands must give back his wealth.
content_old: 10 His sons ingratiate themselves with the poor; His own hands must give back his wealth.

content: 11 His bones, still full of vigor, Lie down in the dust with him.
content_old: 11 His bones, still full of vigor, Lie down in the dust with him.

content: 12 Though evil is sweet to his taste, And he conceals it under his tongue;
content_old: 12 Though evil is sweet to his taste, And he conceals it under his tongue;

content: 13 Though he saves it, does not let it go, Holds it inside his mouth,
content_old: 13 Though he saves it, does not let it go, Holds it inside his mouth,

content: 14 His food in his bowels turns Into asps’ venom within him.

content: 15 The riches he swallows he vomits; God empties it out of his stomach.
content_old: 15 The riches he swallows he vomits; God empties it out of his stomach.

content: 16 He sucks the poison of asps; The tongue of the viper kills him.

content: 17 Let him not enjoy the streams, The rivers of honey, the brooks of cream.
content_old: 17 Let him not enjoy the streams, The rivers of honey, the brooks of cream.

content: 20 He will not see his children tranquil; He will not preserve one of his dear ones.
content_old: 20 He will not see his children tranquil; He will not preserve one of his dear ones.

content: 21 With no survivor to enjoy it, His fortune will not prosper.

content_old: 22 When he has all he wants, trouble will come; Misfortunes of all kinds will batter him.

content_old: 15 What is Shaddai that we should serve Him? What will we gain by praying to Him?”

content: 18 Let them become like straw in the wind, Like chaff carried off by a storm.

content: 19 You say, “God is reserving his punishment for his sons”; Let it be paid back to him that he may feel it,
content_old: 19 You say, “God is reserving his punishment for his sons”; Let it be paid back to him that he may feel it,

content: 20 Let his eyes see his ruin, And let him drink the wrath of Shaddai!
content_old: 20 Let his eyes see his ruin, And let him drink the wrath of Shaddai!

content: 21 For what does he care about the fate of his family, When his number of months runs out?
content_old: 21 For what does he care about the fate of his family, When his number of months runs out?

content: 22 Can God be instructed in knowledge, He who judges from such heights?
content_old: 22 Can God be instructed in knowledge, He who judges from such heights?

content: 23 One man dies in robust health, All tranquil and untroubled;
content_old: 23 One man dies in robust health, All tranquil and untroubled;

content: 24 His pails are full of milk; The marrow of his bones is juicy.
content_old: 24 His pails are full of milk; The marrow of his bones is juicy.

content: 25 Another dies embittered, Never having tasted happiness.
content_old: 25 Another dies embittered, Never having tasted happiness.

content: 26 They both lie in the dust And are covered with worms.
content_old: 26 They both lie in the dust And are covered with worms.

content: 27 Oh, I know your thoughts, And the tactics you will devise against me.
content_old: 27 Oh, I know your thoughts, And the tactics you will devise against me.

content: 28 You will say, “Where is the house of the great man— And where the tent in which the wicked dwelled?”
content_old: 28 You will say, “Where is the house of the great man— And where the tent in which the wicked dwelled?”

content: 29 You must have consulted the wayfarers; You cannot deny their evidence.
content_old: 29 You must have consulted the wayfarers; You cannot deny their evidence.

content: 30 For the evil man is spared on the day of calamity, On the day when wrath is led forth.
content_old: 30 For the evil man is spared on the day of calamity, On the day when wrath is led forth.

content: 31 Who will upbraid him to his face? Who will requite him for what he has done?
content_old: 31 Who will upbraid him to his face? Who will requite him for what he has done?

content: 32 He is brought to the grave, While a watch is kept at his tomb.
content_old: 32 He is brought to the grave, While a watch is kept at his tomb.

content: 33 The clods of the wadi are sweet to him, Everyone follows behind him, Innumerable are those who precede him.

content: 1 Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:
content_old: 1 Eliphaz the Temanite said in reply:

content: 2 Can a man be of use to God, A wise man benefit Him?
content_old: 2 Can a man be of use to God, A wise man benefit Him?

content: 3 Does Shaddai gain if you are righteous? Does He profit if your conduct is blameless?
content_old: 3 Does Shaddai gain if you are righteous? Does He profit if your conduct is blameless?

content: 4 Is it because of your piety that He arraigns you, And enters into judgment with you?
content_old: 4 Is it because of your piety that He arraigns you, And enters into judgment with you?

content: 5 You know that your wickedness is great, And that your iniquities have no limit.
content_old: 5 You know that your wickedness is great, And that your iniquities have no limit.

content: 6 You exact pledges from your fellows without reason, And leave them naked, stripped of their clothes;
content_old: 6 You exact pledges from your fellows without reason, And leave them naked, stripped of their clothes;

content: 7 You do not give the thirsty water to drink; You deny bread to the hungry.
content_old: 7 You do not give the thirsty water to drink; You deny bread to the hungry.

content: 8 The land belongs to the strong; The privileged occupy it.
content_old: 8 The land belongs to the strong; The privileged occupy it.

content: 9 You have sent away widows empty-handed; The strength of the fatherless is broken.
content_old: 9 You have sent away widows empty-handed; The strength of the fatherless is broken.

content: 10 Therefore snares are all around you, And sudden terrors frighten you,
content_old: 10 Therefore snares are all around you, And sudden terrors frighten you,

content: 11 Or darkness, so you cannot see; A flood of waters covers you.
content_old: 11 Or darkness, so you cannot see; A flood of waters covers you.

content: 12 God is in the heavenly heights; See the highest stars, how lofty!
content_old: 12 God is in the heavenly heights; See the highest stars, how lofty!

content: 13 You say, “What can God know? Can He govern through the dense cloud?
content_old: 13 You say, “What can God know? Can He govern through the dense cloud?

content: 14 The clouds screen Him so He cannot see As He moves about the circuit of heaven.”
content_old: 14 The clouds screen Him so He cannot see As He moves about the circuit of heaven.”

content: 15 Have you observed the immemorial path That evil men have trodden;
content_old: 15 Have you observed the immemorial path That evil men have trodden;

content: 16 How they were shriveled up before their time And their foundation poured out like a river?
content_old: 16 How they were shriveled up before their time And their foundation poured out like a river?

content: 17 They said to God, “Leave us alone; What can Shaddai do about it?”
content_old: 17 They said to God, “Leave us alone; What can Shaddai do about it?”

content: 18 But it was He who filled their houses with good things. The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!
content_old: 18 But it was He who filled their houses with good things. The thoughts of the wicked are beyond me!

content: 19 The righteous, seeing it, rejoiced; The innocent laughed with scorn.
content_old: 19 The righteous, seeing it, rejoiced; The innocent laughed with scorn.

content: 20 Surely their substance was destroyed, And their remnant consumed by fire.
content_old: 20 Surely their substance was destroyed, And their remnant consumed by fire.

content: 21 Be close to Him and wholehearted; Good things will come to you thereby.
content_old: 21 Be close to Him and wholehearted; Good things will come to you thereby.

content: 22 Accept instruction from His mouth; Lay up His words in your heart.
content_old: 22 Accept instruction from His mouth; Lay up His words in your heart.

content: 23 If you return to Shaddai you will be restored, If you banish iniquity from your tent;
content_old: 23 If you return to Shaddai you will be restored, If you banish iniquity from your tent;

content: 24 If you regard treasure as dirt, Ophir-gold as stones of the wadi,
content_old: 24 If you regard treasure as dirt, Ophir-gold as stones of the wadi,

content: 25 And Shaddai be your treasure And precious silver for you,
content_old: 25 And Shaddai be your treasure And precious silver for you,

content: 26 When you seek the favor of Shaddai, And lift up your face to God,
content_old: 26 When you seek the favor of Shaddai, And lift up your face to God,

content: 27 You will pray to Him, and He will listen to you, And you will pay your vows.
content_old: 27 You will pray to Him, and He will listen to you, And you will pay your vows.

content: 28 You will decree and it will be fulfilled, And light will shine upon your affairs.
content_old: 28 You will decree and it will be fulfilled, And light will shine upon your affairs.

content: 29 When others sink low, you will say it is pride; For He saves the humble.
content_old: 29 When others sink low, you will say it is pride; For He saves the humble.

content: 1 Job said in reply:
content_old: 1 Job said in reply:

content: 2 Today again my complaint is bitter; My strength is spent on account of my groaning.
content_old: 2 Today again my complaint is bitter; My strength is spent on account of my groaning.

content: 3 Would that I knew how to reach Him, How to get to His dwelling-place.
content_old: 3 Would that I knew how to reach Him, How to get to His dwelling-place.

content: 4 I would set out my case before Him And fill my mouth with arguments.
content_old: 4 I would set out my case before Him And fill my mouth with arguments.

content: 5 I would learn what answers He had for me And know how He would reply to me.
content_old: 5 I would learn what answers He had for me And know how He would reply to me.

content: 6 Would He contend with me overbearingly? Surely He would not accuse me!
content_old: 6 Would He contend with me overbearingly? Surely He would not accuse me!

content: 7 There the upright would be cleared by Him, And I would escape forever from my judge.
content_old: 7 There the upright would be cleared by Him, And I would escape forever from my judge.

content: 8 But if I go East—He is not there; West—I still do not perceive Him;
content_old: 8 But if I go East—He is not there; West—I still do not perceive Him;

content: 9 North—since He is concealed, I do not behold Him; South—He is hidden, and I cannot see Him.
content_old: 9 North—since He is concealed, I do not behold Him; South—He is hidden, and I cannot see Him.

content: 10 But He knows the way I take; Would He assay me, I should emerge pure as gold.
content_old: 10 But He knows the way I take; Would He assay me, I should emerge pure as gold.

content: 11 I have followed in His tracks, Kept His way without swerving,
content_old: 11 I have followed in His tracks, Kept His way without swerving,

content: 12 I have not deviated from what His lips commanded; I have treasured His words more than my daily bread.
content_old: 12 I have not deviated from what His lips commanded; I have treasured His words more than my daily bread.

content: 13 He is one; who can dissuade Him? Whatever He desires, He does.
content_old: 13 He is one; who can dissuade Him? Whatever He desires, He does.

content: 14 For He will bring my term to an end, But He has many more such at His disposal.
content_old: 14 For He will bring my term to an end, But He has many more such at His disposal.

content: 15 Therefore I am terrified at His presence; When I consider, I dread Him.
content_old: 15 Therefore I am terrified at His presence; When I consider, I dread Him.

content: 16 God has made me fainthearted; Shaddai has terrified me.
content_old: 16 God has made me fainthearted; Shaddai has terrified me.

content: 1 Why are times for judgment not reserved by Shaddai? Even those close to Him cannot foresee His actions.
content_old: 1 Why are times for judgment not reserved by Shaddai? Even those close to Him cannot foresee His actions.

content: 2 People remove boundary-stones; They carry off flocks and pasture them;
content_old: 2 People remove boundary-stones; They carry off flocks and pasture them;

content: 3 They lead away the donkeys of the fatherless, And seize the widow’s bull as a pledge;
content_old: 3 They lead away the donkeys of the fatherless, And seize the widow’s bull as a pledge;

content: 4 They chase the needy off the roads; All the poor of the land are forced into hiding.
content_old: 4 They chase the needy off the roads; All the poor of the land are forced into hiding.

content: 5 Like the wild asses of the wilderness, They go about their tasks, seeking food; The wilderness provides each with food for his lads;
content_old: 5 Like the wild asses of the wilderness, They go about their tasks, seeking food; The wilderness provides each with food for his lads;

content: 6 They harvest fodder in the field, And glean the late grapes in the vineyards of the wicked.
content_old: 6 They harvest fodder in the field, And glean the late grapes in the vineyards of the wicked.

content: 7 They pass the night naked for lack of clothing, They have no covering against the cold;
content_old: 7 They pass the night naked for lack of clothing, They have no covering against the cold;

content: 8 They are drenched by the mountain rains, And huddle against the rock for lack of shelter.
content_old: 8 They are drenched by the mountain rains, And huddle against the rock for lack of shelter.

content: 9 They snatch the fatherless infant from the breast, And seize the child of the poor as a pledge.
content_old: 9 They snatch the fatherless infant from the breast, And seize the child of the poor as a pledge.

content: 10 They go about naked for lack of clothing, And, hungry, carry sheaves;
content_old: 10 They go about naked for lack of clothing, And, hungry, carry sheaves;

content: 11 Between rows of olive trees they make oil, And, thirsty, they tread the winepresses.
content_old: 11 Between rows of olive trees they make oil, And, thirsty, they tread the winepresses.

content: 12 Men groan in the city; The souls of the dying cry out; Yet God does not regard it as a reproach.
content_old: 12 Men groan in the city; The souls of the dying cry out; Yet God does not regard it as a reproach.

content: 13 They are rebels against the light; They are strangers to its ways, And do not stay in its path.
content_old: 13 They are rebels against the light; They are strangers to its ways, And do not stay in its path.

content: 14 The murderer arises in the evening To kill the poor and needy, And at night he acts the thief.
content_old: 14 The murderer arises in the evening To kill the poor and needy, And at night he acts the thief.

content: 15 The eyes of the adulterer watch for twilight, Thinking, “No one will glimpse me then.” He masks his face.
content_old: 15 The eyes of the adulterer watch for twilight, Thinking, “No one will glimpse me then.” He masks his face.

content: 16 In the dark they break into houses; By day they shut themselves in; They do not know the light.
content_old: 16 In the dark they break into houses; By day they shut themselves in; They do not know the light.

content: 17 For all of them morning is darkness; It is then that they discern the terror of darkness.
content_old: 17 For all of them morning is darkness; It is then that they discern the terror of darkness.

content: 18 May they be flotsam on the face of the water; May their portion in the land be cursed; May none turn aside by way of their vineyards.
content_old: 18 May they be flotsam on the face of the water; May their portion in the land be cursed; May none turn aside by way of their vineyards.

content: 19 May drought and heat snatch away their snow waters, And Sheol, those who have sinned.
content_old: 19 May drought and heat snatch away their snow waters, And Sheol, those who have sinned.

content: 20 May the womb forget him; May he be sweet to the worms; May he be no longer remembered; May wrongdoers be broken like a tree.
content_old: 20 May the womb forget him; May he be sweet to the worms; May he be no longer remembered; May wrongdoers be broken like a tree.

content: 21 May he consort with a barren woman who bears no child, Leave his widow deprived of good.
content_old: 21 May he consort with a barren woman who bears no child, Leave his widow deprived of good.

content: 22 Though he has the strength to seize bulls, May he live with no assurance of survival.
content_old: 22 Though he has the strength to seize bulls, May he live with no assurance of survival.

content: 23 Yet gives him the security on which he relies, And keeps watch over his affairs.
content_old: 23 Yet gives him the security on which he relies, And keeps watch over his affairs.

content: 24 Exalted for a while, let them be gone; Be brought low, and shrivel like mallows, And wither like the heads of grain.
content_old: 24 Exalted for a while, let them be gone; Be brought low, and shrivel like mallows, And wither like the heads of grain.

content: 3 Can His troops be numbered? On whom does His light not shine?
content_old: 3 Can His troops be numbered? On whom does His light not shine?

content: 4 How can man be in the right before God? How can one born of woman be cleared of guilt?
content_old: 4 How can man be in the right before God? How can one born of woman be cleared of guilt?

content: 5 Even the moon is not bright, And the stars are not pure in His sight.

content: 1 Then Job said in reply:
content_old: 1 Then Job said in reply:

content: 2 You would help without having the strength; You would deliver with arms that have no power.
content_old: 2 You would help without having the strength; You would deliver with arms that have no power.

content: 3 Without having the wisdom, you offer advice And freely give your counsel.
content_old: 3 Without having the wisdom, you offer advice And freely give your counsel.

content: 4 To whom have you addressed words? Whose breath issued from you?
content_old: 4 To whom have you addressed words? Whose breath issued from you?

content: 5 The shades tremble Beneath the waters and their denizens.
content_old: 5 The shades tremble Beneath the waters and their denizens.

content: 6 Sheol is naked before Him; Abaddon has no cover.
content_old: 6 Sheol is naked before Him; Abaddon has no cover.

content: 7 He it is who stretched out Zaphon over chaos, Who suspended earth over emptiness.
content_old: 7 He it is who stretched out Zaphon over chaos, Who suspended earth over emptiness.

content: 8 He wrapped up the waters in His clouds; Yet no cloud burst under their weight.
content_old: 8 He wrapped up the waters in His clouds; Yet no cloud burst under their weight.

content: 9 He shuts off the view of His throne, Spreading His cloud over it.
content_old: 9 He shuts off the view of His throne, Spreading His cloud over it.

content: 10 He drew a boundary on the surface of the waters, At the extreme where light and darkness meet.
content_old: 10 He drew a boundary on the surface of the waters, At the extreme where light and darkness meet.

content: 11 The pillars of heaven tremble, Astounded at His blast.
content_old: 11 The pillars of heaven tremble, Astounded at His blast.

content: 12 By His power He stilled the sea; By His skill He struck down Rahab.
content_old: 12 By His power He stilled the sea; By His skill He struck down Rahab.

content: 13 By His wind the heavens were calmed; His hand pierced the Elusive Serpent.

content: 1 Job again took up his theme and said:
content_old: 1 Job again took up his theme and said:

content: 2 By God who has deprived me of justice! By Shaddai who has embittered my life!
content_old: 2 By God who has deprived me of justice! By Shaddai who has embittered my life!

content: 3 As long as there is life in me, And God’s breath is in my nostrils,
content_old: 3 As long as there is life in me, And God’s breath is in my nostrils,

content: 4 My lips will speak no wrong, Nor my tongue utter deceit.
content_old: 4 My lips will speak no wrong, Nor my tongue utter deceit.

content: 5 Far be it from me to say you are right; Until I die I will maintain my integrity.
content_old: 5 Far be it from me to say you are right; Until I die I will maintain my integrity.

content: 6 I persist in my righteousness and will not yield; I shall be free of reproach as long as I live.
content_old: 6 I persist in my righteousness and will not yield; I shall be free of reproach as long as I live.

content: 7 May my enemy be as the wicked; My assailant, as the wrongdoer.
content_old: 7 May my enemy be as the wicked; My assailant, as the wrongdoer.

content: 8 For what hope has the impious man when he is cut down, When God takes away his life?
content_old: 8 For what hope has the impious man when he is cut down, When God takes away his life?

content: 9 Will God hear his cry When trouble comes upon him,
content_old: 9 Will God hear his cry When trouble comes upon him,

content: 10 When he seeks the favor of Shaddai, Calls upon God at all times?
content_old: 10 When he seeks the favor of Shaddai, Calls upon God at all times?

content: 11 I will teach you what is in God’s power, And what is with Shaddai I will not conceal.
content_old: 11 I will teach you what is in God’s power, And what is with Shaddai I will not conceal.

content: 12 All of you have seen it, So why talk nonsense?
content_old: 12 All of you have seen it, So why talk nonsense?

content: 13 This is the evil man’s portion from God, The lot that the ruthless receive from Shaddai:
content_old: 13 This is the evil man’s portion from God, The lot that the ruthless receive from Shaddai:

content: 14 Should he have many sons—they are marked for the sword; His descendants will never have their fill of bread;
content_old: 14 Should he have many sons—they are marked for the sword; His descendants will never have their fill of bread;

content: 15 Those who survive him will be buried in a plague, And their widows will not weep;
content_old: 15 Those who survive him will be buried in a plague, And their widows will not weep;

content: 16 Should he pile up silver like dust, Lay up clothing like dirt—
content_old: 16 Should he pile up silver like dust, Lay up clothing like dirt—

content: 17 He may lay it up, but the righteous will wear it, And the innocent will share the silver.
content_old: 17 He may lay it up, but the righteous will wear it, And the innocent will share the silver.

content: 18 The house he built is like a bird’s nest, Like the booth a watchman makes.
content_old: 18 The house he built is like a bird’s nest, Like the booth a watchman makes.

content: 19 He lies down, a rich man, with his wealth intact; When he opens his eyes it is gone.
content_old: 19 He lies down, a rich man, with his wealth intact; When he opens his eyes it is gone.

content: 20 Terror overtakes him like a flood; A storm wind makes off with him by night.
content_old: 20 Terror overtakes him like a flood; A storm wind makes off with him by night.

content: 21 The east wind carries him far away, and he is gone; It sweeps him from his place.
content_old: 21 The east wind carries him far away, and he is gone; It sweeps him from his place.

content: 22 Then it hurls itself at him without mercy; He tries to escape from its force.
content_old: 22 Then it hurls itself at him without mercy; He tries to escape from its force.

content: 1 There is a mine for silver, And a place where gold is refined.
content_old: 1 There is a mine for silver, And a place where gold is refined.

content: 2 Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper smelted from rock.
content_old: 2 Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper smelted from rock.

content: 3 He sets bounds for darkness; To every limit man probes, To rocks in deepest darkness.
content_old: 3 He sets bounds for darkness; To every limit man probes, To rocks in deepest darkness.

content: 4 They open up a shaft far from where men live, forgotten by wayfarers, Destitute of men, far removed.
content_old: 4 They open up a shaft far from where men live, forgotten by wayfarers, Destitute of men, far removed.

content: 5 Earth, out of which food grows, Is changed below as if into fire.

content: 6 Its rocks are a source of sapphires; It contains gold dust too.
content_old: 6 Its rocks are a source of sapphires; It contains gold dust too.

content: 7 No bird of prey knows the path to it; The falcon’s eye has not gazed upon it.
content_old: 7 No bird of prey knows the path to it; The falcon’s eye has not gazed upon it.

content: 8 The proud beasts have not reached it; The lion has not crossed it.
content_old: 8 The proud beasts have not reached it; The lion has not crossed it.

content: 9 Man sets his hand against the flinty rock And overturns mountains by the roots.
content_old: 9 Man sets his hand against the flinty rock And overturns mountains by the roots.

content: 10 He carves out channels through rock; His eyes behold every precious thing.
content_old: 10 He carves out channels through rock; His eyes behold every precious thing.

content: 11 He dams up the sources of the streams So that hidden things may be brought to light.
content_old: 11 He dams up the sources of the streams So that hidden things may be brought to light.

content: 12 But where can wisdom be found; Where is the source of understanding?
content_old: 12 But where can wisdom be found; Where is the source of understanding?

content: 13 No man can set a value on it; It cannot be found in the land of the living.
content_old: 13 No man can set a value on it; It cannot be found in the land of the living.

content: 14 The deep says, “It is not in me”; The sea says, “I do not have it.”
content_old: 14 The deep says, “It is not in me”; The sea says, “I do not have it.”

content: 15 It cannot be bartered for gold; Silver cannot be paid out as its price.
content_old: 15 It cannot be bartered for gold; Silver cannot be paid out as its price.

content: 16 The finest gold of Ophir cannot be weighed against it, Nor precious onyx, nor sapphire.
content_old: 16 The finest gold of Ophir cannot be weighed against it, Nor precious onyx, nor sapphire.

content: 17 Gold or glass cannot match its value, Nor vessels of fine gold be exchanged for it.
content_old: 17 Gold or glass cannot match its value, Nor vessels of fine gold be exchanged for it.

content: 18 Coral and crystal cannot be mentioned with it; A pouch of wisdom is better than rubies.
content_old: 18 Coral and crystal cannot be mentioned with it; A pouch of wisdom is better than rubies.

content: 19 Topaz from Nubia cannot match its value; Pure gold cannot be weighed against it.
content_old: 19 Topaz from Nubia cannot match its value; Pure gold cannot be weighed against it.

content: 20 But whence does wisdom come? Where is the source of understanding?
content_old: 20 But whence does wisdom come? Where is the source of understanding?

content: 21 It is hidden from the eyes of all living, Concealed from the fowl of heaven.
content_old: 21 It is hidden from the eyes of all living, Concealed from the fowl of heaven.

content: 22 Abaddon and Death say, “We have only a report of it.”

content: 23 God understands the way to it; He knows its source;

content: 25 When He fixed the weight of the winds, Set the measure of the waters;
content_old: 25 When He fixed the weight of the winds, Set the measure of the waters;
