content: 17 I broke the jaws of the wrongdoer, And I wrested prey from his teeth.
content_old: 17 I broke the jaws of the wrongdoer, And I wrested prey from his teeth.

content: 18 I thought I would end my days with my family, And be as long-lived as the phoenix,
content_old: 18 I thought I would end my days with my family, And be as long-lived as the phoenix,

content: 19 My roots reaching water, And dew lying on my branches;
content_old: 19 My roots reaching water, And dew lying on my branches;

content: 20 My vigor refreshed, My bow ever new in my hand.
content_old: 20 My vigor refreshed, My bow ever new in my hand.

content: 21 Men would listen to me expectantly, And wait for my counsel.
content_old: 21 Men would listen to me expectantly, And wait for my counsel.

content: 22 After I spoke they had nothing to say; My words were as drops of dew upon them.
content_old: 22 After I spoke they had nothing to say; My words were as drops of dew upon them.

content: 23 They waited for me as for rain, For the late rain, their mouths open wide.
content_old: 23 They waited for me as for rain, For the late rain, their mouths open wide.

content: 24 When I smiled at them, they would not believe it; They never expected a sign of my favor.
content_old: 24 When I smiled at them, they would not believe it; They never expected a sign of my favor.

content: 1 But now those younger than I deride me, whose fathers I would have disdained to put among my sheep dogs.
content_old: 1 But now those younger than I deride me, whose fathers I would have disdained to put among my sheep dogs.

content: 2 Of what use to me is the strength of their hands? All their vigor is gone.
content_old: 2 Of what use to me is the strength of their hands? All their vigor is gone.

content: 3 Wasted from want and starvation, They flee to a parched land, To the gloom of desolate wasteland.
content_old: 3 Wasted from want and starvation, They flee to a parched land, To the gloom of desolate wasteland.

content: 4 They pluck saltwort and wormwood; The roots of broom are their food.
content_old: 4 They pluck saltwort and wormwood; The roots of broom are their food.

content: 5 Driven out from society, They are cried at like a thief.
content_old: 5 Driven out from society, They are cried at like a thief.

content: 6 They live in the gullies of wadis, In holes in the ground, and in rocks,
content_old: 6 They live in the gullies of wadis, In holes in the ground, and in rocks,

content: 7 Braying among the bushes, Huddling among the nettles,
content_old: 7 Braying among the bushes, Huddling among the nettles,

content: 8 Scoundrels, nobodies, Stricken from the earth.
content_old: 8 Scoundrels, nobodies, Stricken from the earth.

content: 9 Now I am the butt of their gibes; I have become a byword to them.
content_old: 9 Now I am the butt of their gibes; I have become a byword to them.

content: 10 They abhor me; they keep their distance from me; They do not withhold spittle from my face.
content_old: 10 They abhor me; they keep their distance from me; They do not withhold spittle from my face.

content: 11 Because God has disarmed and humbled me, They have thrown off restraint in my presence.
content_old: 11 Because God has disarmed and humbled me, They have thrown off restraint in my presence.

content: 12 Mere striplings assail me at my right hand: They put me to flight; They build their roads for my ruin.
content_old: 12 Mere striplings assail me at my right hand: They put me to flight; They build their roads for my ruin.

content: 13 They tear up my path; They promote my fall, Although it does them no good.
content_old: 13 They tear up my path; They promote my fall, Although it does them no good.

content: 14 They come as through a wide breach; They roll in like raging billows.
content_old: 14 They come as through a wide breach; They roll in like raging billows.

content: 15 Terror tumbles upon me; It sweeps away my honor like the wind; My dignity vanishes like a cloud.
content_old: 15 Terror tumbles upon me; It sweeps away my honor like the wind; My dignity vanishes like a cloud.

content: 16 So now my life runs out; Days of misery have taken hold of me.
content_old: 16 So now my life runs out; Days of misery have taken hold of me.

content: 17 By night my bones feel gnawed; My sinews never rest.
content_old: 17 By night my bones feel gnawed; My sinews never rest.

content: 18 With great effort I change clothing; The neck of my tunic fits my waist.
content_old: 18 With great effort I change clothing; The neck of my tunic fits my waist.

content: 19 He regarded me as clay, I have become like dust and ashes.
content_old: 19 He regarded me as clay, I have become like dust and ashes.

content: 20 I cry out to You, but You do not answer me; I wait, but You do consider me.
content_old: 20 I cry out to You, but You do not answer me; I wait, but You do consider me.

content: 21 You have become cruel to me; With Your powerful hand You harass me.
content_old: 21 You have become cruel to me; With Your powerful hand You harass me.

content: 22 You lift me up and mount me on the wind; You make my courage melt.
content_old: 22 You lift me up and mount me on the wind; You make my courage melt.

content: 23 I know You will bring me to death, The house assigned for all the living.
content_old: 23 I know You will bring me to death, The house assigned for all the living.

content: 24 Surely He would not strike at a ruin If, in calamity, one cried out to Him.
content_old: 24 Surely He would not strike at a ruin If, in calamity, one cried out to Him.

content: 25 Did I not weep for the unfortunate? Did I not grieve for the needy?
content_old: 25 Did I not weep for the unfortunate? Did I not grieve for the needy?

content: 26 I looked forward to good fortune, but evil came; I hoped for light, but darkness came.
content_old: 26 I looked forward to good fortune, but evil came; I hoped for light, but darkness came.

content: 27 My bowels are in turmoil without respite; Days of misery confront me.
content_old: 27 My bowels are in turmoil without respite; Days of misery confront me.

content: 28 I walk about in sunless gloom; I rise in the assembly and cry out.
content_old: 28 I walk about in sunless gloom; I rise in the assembly and cry out.

content: 29 I have become a brother to jackals, A companion to ostriches.
content_old: 29 I have become a brother to jackals, A companion to ostriches.

content: 30 My skin, blackened, is peeling off me; My bones are charred by the heat.
content_old: 30 My skin, blackened, is peeling off me; My bones are charred by the heat.

content: 1 I have covenanted with my eyes Not to gaze on a maiden.
content_old: 1 I have covenanted with my eyes Not to gaze on a maiden.

content: 2 What fate is decreed by God above? What lot, by Shaddai in the heights?
content_old: 2 What fate is decreed by God above? What lot, by Shaddai in the heights?

content: 3 Calamity is surely for the iniquitous; Misfortune, for the worker of mischief.
content_old: 3 Calamity is surely for the iniquitous; Misfortune, for the worker of mischief.

content: 4 Surely He observes my ways, Takes account of my every step.
content_old: 4 Surely He observes my ways, Takes account of my every step.

content: 5 Have I walked with worthless men, Or my feet hurried to deceit?
content_old: 5 Have I walked with worthless men, Or my feet hurried to deceit?

content: 6 Let Him weigh me on the scale of righteousness; Let God ascertain my integrity.
content_old: 6 Let Him weigh me on the scale of righteousness; Let God ascertain my integrity.

content: 7 If my feet have strayed from their course, My heart followed after my eyes, And a stain sullied my hands,
content_old: 7 If my feet have strayed from their course, My heart followed after my eyes, And a stain sullied my hands,

content: 8 May I sow, but another reap, May the growth of my field be uprooted!
content_old: 8 May I sow, but another reap, May the growth of my field be uprooted!

content: 9 If my heart was ravished by the wife of my neighbor, And I lay in wait at his door,
content_old: 9 If my heart was ravished by the wife of my neighbor, And I lay in wait at his door,

content: 10 May my wife grind for another, May others kneel over her!
content_old: 10 May my wife grind for another, May others kneel over her!

content: 11 For that would have been debauchery, A criminal offense,
content_old: 11 For that would have been debauchery, A criminal offense,

content: 12 A fire burning down to Abaddon, Consuming the roots of all my increase.
content_old: 12 A fire burning down to Abaddon, Consuming the roots of all my increase.

content: 13 Did I ever brush aside the case of my servants, man or maid, When they made a complaint against me?
content_old: 13 Did I ever brush aside the case of my servants, man or maid, When they made a complaint against me?

content: 14 What then should I do when God arises; When He calls me to account, what should I answer Him?
content_old: 14 What then should I do when God arises; When He calls me to account, what should I answer Him?

content: 15 Did not He who made me in my mother’s belly make him? Did not One form us both in the womb?
content_old: 15 Did not He who made me in my mother’s belly make him? Did not One form us both in the womb?

content: 16 Did I deny the poor their needs, Or let a widow pine away,
content_old: 16 Did I deny the poor their needs, Or let a widow pine away,

content: 17 By eating my food alone, The fatherless not eating of it also?
content_old: 17 By eating my food alone, The fatherless not eating of it also?

content: 18 Why, from my youth he grew up with me as though I were his father; Since I left my mother’s womb I was her guide.
content_old: 18 Why, from my youth he grew up with me as though I were his father; Since I left my mother’s womb I was her guide.

content: 19 I never saw an unclad wretch, A needy man without clothing,
content_old: 19 I never saw an unclad wretch, A needy man without clothing,

content: 20 Whose loins did not bless me As he warmed himself with the shearings of my sheep.
content_old: 20 Whose loins did not bless me As he warmed himself with the shearings of my sheep.

content: 21 If I raised my hand against the fatherless, Looking to my supporters in the gate,
content_old: 21 If I raised my hand against the fatherless, Looking to my supporters in the gate,

content: 22 May my arm drop off my shoulder; My forearm break off at the elbow.
content_old: 22 May my arm drop off my shoulder; My forearm break off at the elbow.

content: 23 For I am in dread of God-sent calamity; I cannot bear His threat.
content_old: 23 For I am in dread of God-sent calamity; I cannot bear His threat.

content: 24 Did I put my reliance on gold, Or regard fine gold as my bulwark?
content_old: 24 Did I put my reliance on gold, Or regard fine gold as my bulwark?

content: 25 Did I rejoice in my great wealth, In having attained plenty?
content_old: 25 Did I rejoice in my great wealth, In having attained plenty?

content: 26 If ever I saw the light shining, The moon on its course in full glory,
content_old: 26 If ever I saw the light shining, The moon on its course in full glory,

content: 27 And I secretly succumbed, And my hand touched my mouth in a kiss,
content_old: 27 And I secretly succumbed, And my hand touched my mouth in a kiss,

content: 28 That, too, would have been a criminal offense, For I would have denied God above.
content_old: 28 That, too, would have been a criminal offense, For I would have denied God above.

content: 29 Did I rejoice over my enemy’s misfortune? Did I thrill because evil befell him?
content_old: 29 Did I rejoice over my enemy’s misfortune? Did I thrill because evil befell him?

content: 30 I never let my mouth sin By wishing his death in a curse.
content_old: 30 I never let my mouth sin By wishing his death in a curse.

content: 31 Indeed, the men of my clan said, “We would consume his flesh insatiably!”
content_old: 31 Indeed, the men of my clan said, “We would consume his flesh insatiably!”

content: 32 No sojourner spent the night in the open; I opened my doors to the road.
content_old: 32 No sojourner spent the night in the open; I opened my doors to the road.

content: 33 Did I hide my transgressions like Adam, Bury my wrongdoing in my bosom,
content_old: 33 Did I hide my transgressions like Adam, Bury my wrongdoing in my bosom,

content: 34 That I should fear the great multitude, And am shattered by the contempt of families, So that I keep silent and do not step outdoors?
content_old: 34 That I should fear the great multitude, And am shattered by the contempt of families, So that I keep silent and do not step outdoors?

content: 35 O that I had someone to give me a hearing; O that Shaddai would reply to my writ, Or my accuser draw up a true bill!
content_old: 35 O that I had someone to give me a hearing; O that Shaddai would reply to my writ, Or my accuser draw up a true bill!

content: 36 I would carry it on my shoulder; Tie it around me for a wreath.
content_old: 36 I would carry it on my shoulder; Tie it around me for a wreath.

content: 37 I would give him an account of my steps, Offer it as to a commander.
content_old: 37 I would give him an account of my steps, Offer it as to a commander.

content: 38 If my land cries out against me, Its furrows weep together;
content_old: 38 If my land cries out against me, Its furrows weep together;

content: 39 If I have eaten its produce without payment, And made its owners despair,
content_old: 39 If I have eaten its produce without payment, And made its owners despair,

content: 1 These three men ceased replying to Job, for he considered himself right.
content_old: 1 These three men ceased replying to Job, for he considered himself right.

content: 2 Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was angry—angry at Job because he thought himself right against God.
content_old: 2 Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram, was angry—angry at Job because he thought himself right against God.

content: 3 He was angry as well at his three friends, because they found no reply, but merely condemned Job.
content_old: 3 He was angry as well at his three friends, because they found no reply, but merely condemned Job.

content: 4 Elihu waited out Job’s speech, for they were all older than he.
content_old: 4 Elihu waited out Job’s speech, for they were all older than he.

content: 5 But when Elihu saw that the three men had nothing to reply, he was angry.
content_old: 5 But when Elihu saw that the three men had nothing to reply, he was angry.

content: 6 Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite said in reply: I have but few years, while you are old; Therefore I was too awestruck and fearful To hold forth among you.
content_old: 6 Then Elihu son of Barachel the Buzite said in reply: I have but few years, while you are old; Therefore I was too awestruck and fearful To hold forth among you.

content: 7 I thought, “Let age speak; Let advanced years declare wise things.”
content_old: 7 I thought, “Let age speak; Let advanced years declare wise things.”

content: 8 But truly it is the spirit in men, The breath of Shaddai, that gives them understanding.
content_old: 8 But truly it is the spirit in men, The breath of Shaddai, that gives them understanding.

content: 9 It is not the aged who are wise, The elders, who understand how to judge.
content_old: 9 It is not the aged who are wise, The elders, who understand how to judge.

content: 10 Therefore I say, “Listen to me; I too would hold forth.”
content_old: 10 Therefore I say, “Listen to me; I too would hold forth.”

content: 11 Here I have waited out your speeches, I have given ear to your insights, While you probed the issues;
content_old: 11 Here I have waited out your speeches, I have given ear to your insights, While you probed the issues;

content: 12 But as I attended to you, I saw that none of you could argue with Job, Or offer replies to his statements.
content_old: 12 But as I attended to you, I saw that none of you could argue with Job, Or offer replies to his statements.

content: 13 I fear you will say, “We have found the wise course; God will defeat him, not man.”
content_old: 13 I fear you will say, “We have found the wise course; God will defeat him, not man.”

content: 14 He did not set out his case against me, Nor shall I use your reasons to reply to him.
content_old: 14 He did not set out his case against me, Nor shall I use your reasons to reply to him.

content: 15 They have been broken and can no longer reply; Words fail them.
content_old: 15 They have been broken and can no longer reply; Words fail them.

content: 16 I have waited till they stopped speaking, Till they ended and no longer replied.
content_old: 16 I have waited till they stopped speaking, Till they ended and no longer replied.

content: 17 Now I also would have my say; I too would like to hold forth,
content_old: 17 Now I also would have my say; I too would like to hold forth,

content: 18 For I am full of words; The wind in my belly presses me.
content_old: 18 For I am full of words; The wind in my belly presses me.

content: 19 My belly is like wine not yet opened, Like jugs of new wine ready to burst.
content_old: 19 My belly is like wine not yet opened, Like jugs of new wine ready to burst.

content: 20 Let me speak, then, and get relief; Let me open my lips and reply.
content_old: 20 Let me speak, then, and get relief; Let me open my lips and reply.

content: 21 I would not show regard for any man, Or temper my speech for anyone’s sake;
content_old: 21 I would not show regard for any man, Or temper my speech for anyone’s sake;

content: 1 But now, Job, listen to my words, Give ear to all that I say.
content_old: 1 But now, Job, listen to my words, Give ear to all that I say.

content: 2 Now I open my lips; My tongue forms words in my mouth.
content_old: 2 Now I open my lips; My tongue forms words in my mouth.

content: 3 My words bespeak the uprightness of my heart; My lips utter insight honestly.
content_old: 3 My words bespeak the uprightness of my heart; My lips utter insight honestly.

content: 4 The spirit of God formed me; The breath of Shaddai sustains me.
content_old: 4 The spirit of God formed me; The breath of Shaddai sustains me.

content: 5 If you can, answer me; Argue against me, take your stand.
content_old: 5 If you can, answer me; Argue against me, take your stand.

content: 6 You and I are the same before God; I too was nipped from clay.
content_old: 6 You and I are the same before God; I too was nipped from clay.

content: 7 You are not overwhelmed by fear of me; My pressure does not weigh heavily on you.
content_old: 7 You are not overwhelmed by fear of me; My pressure does not weigh heavily on you.

content: 8 Indeed, you have stated in my hearing, I heard the words spoken,
content_old: 8 Indeed, you have stated in my hearing, I heard the words spoken,

content: 9 “I am guiltless, free from transgression; I am innocent, without iniquity.
content_old: 9 “I am guiltless, free from transgression; I am innocent, without iniquity.

content: 10 But He finds reasons to oppose me, Considers me His enemy.
content_old: 10 But He finds reasons to oppose me, Considers me His enemy.

content: 11 He puts my feet in stocks, Watches all my ways.”
content_old: 11 He puts my feet in stocks, Watches all my ways.”

content: 12 In this you are not right; I will answer you: God is greater than any man.
content_old: 12 In this you are not right; I will answer you: God is greater than any man.

content: 13 Why do you complain against Him That He does not reply to any of man’s charges?
content_old: 13 Why do you complain against Him That He does not reply to any of man’s charges?

content: 14 For God speaks time and again —Though man does not perceive it—
content_old: 14 For God speaks time and again —Though man does not perceive it—

content: 15 In a dream, a night vision, When deep sleep falls on men, While they slumber on their beds.
content_old: 15 In a dream, a night vision, When deep sleep falls on men, While they slumber on their beds.

content: 16 Then He opens men’s understanding, And by disciplining them leaves His signature
content_old: 16 Then He opens men’s understanding, And by disciplining them leaves His signature

content: 17 To turn man away from an action, To suppress pride in man.
content_old: 17 To turn man away from an action, To suppress pride in man.

content: 18 He spares him from the Pit, His person, from perishing by the sword.
content_old: 18 He spares him from the Pit, His person, from perishing by the sword.

content: 19 He is reproved by pains on his bed, And the trembling in his bones is constant.
content_old: 19 He is reproved by pains on his bed, And the trembling in his bones is constant.

content: 20 He detests food; Fine food to him.
content_old: 20 He detests food; Fine food to him.

content: 21 His flesh wastes away till it cannot be seen, And his bones are rubbed away till they are invisible.
content_old: 21 His flesh wastes away till it cannot be seen, And his bones are rubbed away till they are invisible.

content: 22 He comes close to the Pit, His life on death.
content_old: 22 He comes close to the Pit, His life on death.

content: 23 If he has a representative, One advocate against a thousand To declare the man’s uprightness,
content_old: 23 If he has a representative, One advocate against a thousand To declare the man’s uprightness,

content: 24 Then He has mercy on him and decrees, “Redeem him from descending to the Pit, For I have obtained his ransom;
content_old: 24 Then He has mercy on him and decrees, “Redeem him from descending to the Pit, For I have obtained his ransom;

content: 25 Let his flesh be healthier than in his youth; Let him return to his younger days.”
content_old: 25 Let his flesh be healthier than in his youth; Let him return to his younger days.”

content: 26 He prays to God and is accepted by Him; He enters His presence with shouts of joy, For He requites a man for his righteousness.
content_old: 26 He prays to God and is accepted by Him; He enters His presence with shouts of joy, For He requites a man for his righteousness.

content: 27 He declares to men, “I have sinned; I have perverted what was right; But I was not paid back for it.”
content_old: 27 He declares to men, “I have sinned; I have perverted what was right; But I was not paid back for it.”

content: 28 He redeemed him from passing into the Pit; He will enjoy the light.
content_old: 28 He redeemed him from passing into the Pit; He will enjoy the light.

content: 29 Truly, God does all these things Two or three times to a man,
content_old: 29 Truly, God does all these things Two or three times to a man,

content: 30 To bring him back from the Pit, That he may bask in the light of life.
content_old: 30 To bring him back from the Pit, That he may bask in the light of life.

content: 31 Pay heed, Job, and hear me; Be still, and I will speak;
content_old: 31 Pay heed, Job, and hear me; Be still, and I will speak;

content: 32 If you have what to say, answer me; Speak, for I am eager to vindicate you.
content_old: 32 If you have what to say, answer me; Speak, for I am eager to vindicate you.

content: 1 Elihu said in reply:
content_old: 1 Elihu said in reply:

content: 2 Listen, O wise men, to my words; You who have knowledge, give ear to me.
content_old: 2 Listen, O wise men, to my words; You who have knowledge, give ear to me.

content: 3 For the ear tests arguments As the palate tastes food.
content_old: 3 For the ear tests arguments As the palate tastes food.

content: 4 Let us decide for ourselves what is just; Let us know among ourselves what is good.
content_old: 4 Let us decide for ourselves what is just; Let us know among ourselves what is good.

content: 5 For Job has said, “I am right; God has deprived me of justice.
content_old: 5 For Job has said, “I am right; God has deprived me of justice.

content: 6 I declare the judgment against me false; My arrow-wound is deadly, though I am free from transgression.”
content_old: 6 I declare the judgment against me false; My arrow-wound is deadly, though I am free from transgression.”

content: 7 What man is like Job, Who drinks mockery like water;
content_old: 7 What man is like Job, Who drinks mockery like water;

content: 8 Who makes common cause with evildoers, And goes with wicked men?
content_old: 8 Who makes common cause with evildoers, And goes with wicked men?

content: 9 For he says, “Man gains nothing When he is in God’s favor.”
content_old: 9 For he says, “Man gains nothing When he is in God’s favor.”

content: 10 Therefore, men of understanding, listen to me; Wickedness be far from God, Wrongdoing, from Shaddai!
content_old: 10 Therefore, men of understanding, listen to me; Wickedness be far from God, Wrongdoing, from Shaddai!

content: 11 For He pays a man according to his actions, And provides for him according to his conduct;
content_old: 11 For He pays a man according to his actions, And provides for him according to his conduct;

content: 12 For God surely does not act wickedly; Shaddai does not pervert justice.
content_old: 12 For God surely does not act wickedly; Shaddai does not pervert justice.

content: 13 Who placed the earth in His charge? Who ordered the entire world?
content_old: 13 Who placed the earth in His charge? Who ordered the entire world?

content: 14 If He but intends it, He can call back His spirit and breath;
content_old: 14 If He but intends it, He can call back His spirit and breath;

content: 15 All flesh would at once expire, And mankind return to dust.
content_old: 15 All flesh would at once expire, And mankind return to dust.

content: 16 If you would understand, listen to this; Give ear to what I say.
content_old: 16 If you would understand, listen to this; Give ear to what I say.

content: 17 Would one who hates justice govern? Would you condemn the Just Mighty One?
content_old: 17 Would one who hates justice govern? Would you condemn the Just Mighty One?

content: 18 Would you call a king a scoundrel, Great men, wicked?
content_old: 18 Would you call a king a scoundrel, Great men, wicked?

content: 19 He is not partial to princes; The noble are not preferred to the wretched; For all of them are the work of His hands.
content_old: 19 He is not partial to princes; The noble are not preferred to the wretched; For all of them are the work of His hands.

content: 20 Some die suddenly in the middle of the night; People are in turmoil and pass on; Even great men are removed—not by human hands.
content_old: 20 Some die suddenly in the middle of the night; People are in turmoil and pass on; Even great men are removed—not by human hands.

content: 21 For His eyes are upon a man’s ways; He observes his every step.
content_old: 21 For His eyes are upon a man’s ways; He observes his every step.

content: 22 Neither darkness nor gloom offers A hiding-place for evildoers.
content_old: 22 Neither darkness nor gloom offers A hiding-place for evildoers.

content: 23 He has no set time for man To appear before God in judgment.
content_old: 23 He has no set time for man To appear before God in judgment.

content: 24 He shatters mighty men without number And sets others in their place.
content_old: 24 He shatters mighty men without number And sets others in their place.

content: 25 Truly, He knows their deeds; Night is over, and they are crushed.
content_old: 25 Truly, He knows their deeds; Night is over, and they are crushed.

content: 26 He strikes them down with the wicked Where people can see,
content_old: 26 He strikes them down with the wicked Where people can see,

content: 27 Because they have been disloyal to Him And have not understood any of His ways;
content_old: 27 Because they have been disloyal to Him And have not understood any of His ways;

content: 28 Thus He lets the cry of the poor come before Him; He listens to the cry of the needy.
content_old: 28 Thus He lets the cry of the poor come before Him; He listens to the cry of the needy.

content: 29 When He is silent, who will condemn? If He hides His face, who will see Him, Be it nation or man?
content_old: 29 When He is silent, who will condemn? If He hides His face, who will see Him, Be it nation or man?

content: 30 The impious man rule no more, Nor do those who ensnare the people.
content_old: 30 The impious man rule no more, Nor do those who ensnare the people.

content: 31 Has he said to God, “I will bear my punishment and offend no more.
content_old: 31 Has he said to God, “I will bear my punishment and offend no more.

content: 32 What I cannot see You teach me. If I have done iniquity, I shall not do so again”?
content_old: 32 What I cannot see You teach me. If I have done iniquity, I shall not do so again”?

content: 33 Should He requite as you see fit? But you have despised! You must decide, not I; Speak what you know.
content_old: 33 Should He requite as you see fit? But you have despised! You must decide, not I; Speak what you know.

content: 34 Men of understanding say to me, Wise men who hear me,
content_old: 34 Men of understanding say to me, Wise men who hear me,

content: 35 “Job does not speak with knowledge; His words lack understanding.”
content_old: 35 “Job does not speak with knowledge; His words lack understanding.”

content: 36 Would that Job were tried to the limit For answers which befit sinful men.
content_old: 36 Would that Job were tried to the limit For answers which befit sinful men.

content: 1 Elihu said in reply:
content_old: 1 Elihu said in reply:

content: 2 Do you think it just To say, “I am right against God”?
content_old: 2 Do you think it just To say, “I am right against God”?

content: 3 If you ask how it benefits you, “What have I gained from not sinning?”
content_old: 3 If you ask how it benefits you, “What have I gained from not sinning?”

content: 4 I shall give you a reply, You, along with your friends.
content_old: 4 I shall give you a reply, You, along with your friends.

content: 5 Behold the heavens and see; Look at the skies high above you.
content_old: 5 Behold the heavens and see; Look at the skies high above you.

content: 6 If you sin, what do you do to Him? If your transgressions are many, How do you affect Him?
content_old: 6 If you sin, what do you do to Him? If your transgressions are many, How do you affect Him?

content: 7 If you are righteous, What do you give Him; What does He receive from your hand?
content_old: 7 If you are righteous, What do you give Him; What does He receive from your hand?

content: 8 Your wickedness affects men like yourself; Your righteousness, mortals.
content_old: 8 Your wickedness affects men like yourself; Your righteousness, mortals.

content: 9 Because of contention the oppressed cry out; They shout because of the power of the great.
content_old: 9 Because of contention the oppressed cry out; They shout because of the power of the great.

content: 10 But none says, “Where is my God, my Maker, Who gives strength in the night;
content_old: 10 But none says, “Where is my God, my Maker, Who gives strength in the night;

content: 11 Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth, Makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?”
content_old: 11 Who gives us more knowledge than the beasts of the earth, Makes us wiser than the birds of the sky?”

content: 12 Then they cry out, but He does not respond Because of the arrogance of evil men.
content_old: 12 Then they cry out, but He does not respond Because of the arrogance of evil men.

content: 13 Surely it is false that God does not listen, That Shaddai does not take note of it.
content_old: 13 Surely it is false that God does not listen, That Shaddai does not take note of it.

content: 14 Though you say, “You do not take note of it,” The case is before Him; So wait for Him.
content_old: 14 Though you say, “You do not take note of it,” The case is before Him; So wait for Him.

content: 15 But since now it does not seem so, He vents his anger; He does not realize that it may be long drawn out.
content_old: 15 But since now it does not seem so, He vents his anger; He does not realize that it may be long drawn out.

content: 1 Then Elihu spoke once more.
content_old: 1 Then Elihu spoke once more.

content: 2 Wait a little and let me hold forth; There is still more to say for God.
content_old: 2 Wait a little and let me hold forth; There is still more to say for God.

content: 3 I will make my opinions widely known; I will justify my Maker.
content_old: 3 I will make my opinions widely known; I will justify my Maker.

content: 4 In truth, my words are not false; A man of sound opinions is before you.
content_old: 4 In truth, my words are not false; A man of sound opinions is before you.

content: 5 See, God is mighty; He is not contemptuous; He is mighty in strength and mind.
content_old: 5 See, God is mighty; He is not contemptuous; He is mighty in strength and mind.

content: 6 He does not let the wicked live; He grants justice to the lowly.
content_old: 6 He does not let the wicked live; He grants justice to the lowly.

content: 7 He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous; With kings on thrones He seats them forever, and they are exalted.
content_old: 7 He does not withdraw His eyes from the righteous; With kings on thrones He seats them forever, and they are exalted.

content: 8 If they are bound in shackles And caught in trammels of affliction,
content_old: 8 If they are bound in shackles And caught in trammels of affliction,

content: 9 He declares to them what they have done, And that their transgressions are excessive;
content_old: 9 He declares to them what they have done, And that their transgressions are excessive;

content: 10 He opens their understanding by discipline, And orders them back from mischief.
content_old: 10 He opens their understanding by discipline, And orders them back from mischief.

content: 11 If they will serve obediently, They shall spend their days in happiness, Their years in delight.
content_old: 11 If they will serve obediently, They shall spend their days in happiness, Their years in delight.

content: 12 But if they are not obedient, They shall perish by the sword, Die for lack of understanding.
content_old: 12 But if they are not obedient, They shall perish by the sword, Die for lack of understanding.

content: 13 But the impious in heart become enraged; They do not cry for help when He afflicts them.
content_old: 13 But the impious in heart become enraged; They do not cry for help when He afflicts them.

content: 14 They die in their youth; among the depraved.
content_old: 14 They die in their youth; among the depraved.

content: 15 He rescues the lowly from their affliction, And opens their understanding through distress.
content_old: 15 He rescues the lowly from their affliction, And opens their understanding through distress.

content: 16 Indeed, He draws you away from the brink of distress To a broad place where there is no constraint; Your table is laid out with rich food.
content_old: 16 Indeed, He draws you away from the brink of distress To a broad place where there is no constraint; Your table is laid out with rich food.

content: 17 You are obsessed with the case of the wicked man, But the justice of the case will be upheld.
content_old: 17 You are obsessed with the case of the wicked man, But the justice of the case will be upheld.

content: 18 Let anger at his affluence not mislead you; Let much bribery not turn you aside.
content_old: 18 Let anger at his affluence not mislead you; Let much bribery not turn you aside.

content: 19 Will your limitless wealth avail you, All your powerful efforts?
content_old: 19 Will your limitless wealth avail you, All your powerful efforts?

content: 20 Do not long for the night When peoples vanish where they are.
content_old: 20 Do not long for the night When peoples vanish where they are.

content: 21 Beware! Do not turn to mischief; Because of that you have been tried by affliction.
content_old: 21 Beware! Do not turn to mischief; Because of that you have been tried by affliction.

content: 22 See, God is beyond reach in His power; Who governs like Him?
content_old: 22 See, God is beyond reach in His power; Who governs like Him?

content: 23 Who ever reproached Him for His conduct? Who ever said, “You have done wrong”?
content_old: 23 Who ever reproached Him for His conduct? Who ever said, “You have done wrong”?

content: 24 Remember, then, to magnify His work, Of which men have sung,
content_old: 24 Remember, then, to magnify His work, Of which men have sung,

content: 25 Which all men have beheld, Men have seen, from a distance.
content_old: 25 Which all men have beheld, Men have seen, from a distance.

content: 26 See, God is greater than we can know; The number of His years cannot be counted.
content_old: 26 See, God is greater than we can know; The number of His years cannot be counted.

content: 27 He forms the droplets of water, Which cluster into rain, from His mist.
content_old: 27 He forms the droplets of water, Which cluster into rain, from His mist.

content: 28 The skies rain; They pour down on all mankind.
content_old: 28 The skies rain; They pour down on all mankind.

content: 29 Can one, indeed, contemplate the expanse of clouds, The thunderings from His pavilion?
content_old: 29 Can one, indeed, contemplate the expanse of clouds, The thunderings from His pavilion?

content: 30 See, He spreads His lightning over it; It fills the bed of the sea.
content_old: 30 See, He spreads His lightning over it; It fills the bed of the sea.

content: 31 By these things He controls peoples; He gives food in abundance.
content_old: 31 By these things He controls peoples; He gives food in abundance.

content: 32 Lightning fills His hands; He orders it to hit the mark.
content_old: 32 Lightning fills His hands; He orders it to hit the mark.

content: 1 Because of this, too, my heart quakes, And leaps from its place.
content_old: 1 Because of this, too, my heart quakes, And leaps from its place.

content: 2 Just listen to the noise of His rumbling, To the sound that comes out of His mouth.
content_old: 2 Just listen to the noise of His rumbling, To the sound that comes out of His mouth.

content: 3 He lets it loose beneath the entire heavens— His lightning, to the ends of the earth.
content_old: 3 He lets it loose beneath the entire heavens— His lightning, to the ends of the earth.

content: 4 After it, He lets out a roar; He thunders in His majestic voice. No one can find a trace of it by the time His voice is heard.
content_old: 4 After it, He lets out a roar; He thunders in His majestic voice. No one can find a trace of it by the time His voice is heard.

content: 5 God thunders marvelously with His voice; He works wonders that we cannot understand.
content_old: 5 God thunders marvelously with His voice; He works wonders that we cannot understand.

content: 6 He commands the snow, “Fall to the ground!” And the downpour of rain, His mighty downpour of rain,
content_old: 6 He commands the snow, “Fall to the ground!” And the downpour of rain, His mighty downpour of rain,

content: 7 Is as a sign on every man’s hand, That all men may know His doings.
content_old: 7 Is as a sign on every man’s hand, That all men may know His doings.

content: 8 Then the beast enters its lair, And remains in its den.
content_old: 8 Then the beast enters its lair, And remains in its den.

content: 9 The storm wind comes from its chamber, And the cold from the constellations.
content_old: 9 The storm wind comes from its chamber, And the cold from the constellations.

content: 10 By the breath of God ice is formed, And the expanse of water becomes solid.
content_old: 10 By the breath of God ice is formed, And the expanse of water becomes solid.

content: 11 He also loads the clouds with moisture And scatters His lightning-clouds.
content_old: 11 He also loads the clouds with moisture And scatters His lightning-clouds.

content: 12 He keeps turning events by His stratagems, That they might accomplish all that He commands them Throughout the inhabited earth,
content_old: 12 He keeps turning events by His stratagems, That they might accomplish all that He commands them Throughout the inhabited earth,

content: 13 Causing each of them to happen to His land, Whether as a scourge or as a blessing.
content_old: 13 Causing each of them to happen to His land, Whether as a scourge or as a blessing.

content: 14 Give ear to this, Job; Stop to consider the marvels of God.
content_old: 14 Give ear to this, Job; Stop to consider the marvels of God.

content: 15 Do you know what charge God lays upon them When His lightning-clouds shine?
content_old: 15 Do you know what charge God lays upon them When His lightning-clouds shine?

content: 16 Do you know the marvels worked upon the expanse of clouds By Him whose understanding is perfect,
content_old: 16 Do you know the marvels worked upon the expanse of clouds By Him whose understanding is perfect,

content: 17 Why your clothes become hot When the land is becalmed by the south wind?
content_old: 17 Why your clothes become hot When the land is becalmed by the south wind?

content: 18 Can you help him stretch out the heavens, Firm as a mirror of cast metal?
content_old: 18 Can you help him stretch out the heavens, Firm as a mirror of cast metal?

content: 19 Inform us, then, what we may say to Him; We cannot argue because we are in darkness.
content_old: 19 Inform us, then, what we may say to Him; We cannot argue because we are in darkness.

content: 20 Is anything conveyed to Him when I speak? Can a man say anything when he is confused?
content_old: 20 Is anything conveyed to Him when I speak? Can a man say anything when he is confused?

content: 21 Now, then, one cannot see the sun, Though it be bright in the heavens, Until the wind comes and clears them.
content_old: 21 Now, then, one cannot see the sun, Though it be bright in the heavens, Until the wind comes and clears them.

content: 22 By the north wind the golden rays emerge; The splendor about God is awesome.
content_old: 22 By the north wind the golden rays emerge; The splendor about God is awesome.

content: 23 Shaddai—we cannot attain to Him; He is great in power and justice And abundant in righteousness; He does not torment.
content_old: 23 Shaddai—we cannot attain to Him; He is great in power and justice And abundant in righteousness; He does not torment.

content: 1 Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:
content_old: 1 Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:

content: 2 Who is this who darkens counsel, Speaking without knowledge?
content_old: 2 Who is this who darkens counsel, Speaking without knowledge?

content: 3 Gird your loins like a man; I will ask and you will inform Me.
content_old: 3 Gird your loins like a man; I will ask and you will inform Me.

content: 4 Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundations? Speak if you have understanding.
content_old: 4 Where were you when I laid the earth’s foundations? Speak if you have understanding.

content: 5 Do you know who fixed its dimensions Or who measured it with a line?
content_old: 5 Do you know who fixed its dimensions Or who measured it with a line?

content: 6 Onto what were its bases sunk? Who set its cornerstone
content_old: 6 Onto what were its bases sunk? Who set its cornerstone

content: 7 When the morning stars sang together And all the divine beings shouted for joy?
content_old: 7 When the morning stars sang together And all the divine beings shouted for joy?

content: 8 Who closed the sea behind doors When it gushed forth out of the womb,
content_old: 8 Who closed the sea behind doors When it gushed forth out of the womb,

content: 9 When I clothed it in clouds, Swaddled it in dense clouds,
content_old: 9 When I clothed it in clouds, Swaddled it in dense clouds,

content: 10 When I made breakers My limit for it, And set up its bar and doors,
content_old: 10 When I made breakers My limit for it, And set up its bar and doors,

content: 11 And said, “You may come so far and no farther; Here your surging waves will stop”?
content_old: 11 And said, “You may come so far and no farther; Here your surging waves will stop”?

content: 12 Have you ever commanded the day to break, Assigned the dawn its place,
content_old: 12 Have you ever commanded the day to break, Assigned the dawn its place,

content: 13 So that it seizes the corners of the earth And shakes the wicked out of it?
content_old: 13 So that it seizes the corners of the earth And shakes the wicked out of it?

content: 14 It changes like clay under the seal Till are fixed like those of a garment.
content_old: 14 It changes like clay under the seal Till are fixed like those of a garment.

content: 15 Their light is withheld from the wicked, And the upraised arm is broken.
content_old: 15 Their light is withheld from the wicked, And the upraised arm is broken.

content: 16 Have you penetrated to the sources of the sea, Or walked in the recesses of the deep?
content_old: 16 Have you penetrated to the sources of the sea, Or walked in the recesses of the deep?

content: 17 Have the gates of death been disclosed to you? Have you seen the gates of deep darkness?
content_old: 17 Have the gates of death been disclosed to you? Have you seen the gates of deep darkness?

content: 18 Have you surveyed the expanses of the earth? If you know of these—tell Me.
content_old: 18 Have you surveyed the expanses of the earth? If you know of these—tell Me.

content: 19 Which path leads to where light dwells, And where is the place of darkness,
content_old: 19 Which path leads to where light dwells, And where is the place of darkness,

content: 20 That you may take it to its domain And know the way to its home?
content_old: 20 That you may take it to its domain And know the way to its home?

content: 21 Surely you know, for you were born then, And the number of your years is many!
content_old: 21 Surely you know, for you were born then, And the number of your years is many!

content: 22 Have you penetrated the vaults of snow, Seen the vaults of hail,
content_old: 22 Have you penetrated the vaults of snow, Seen the vaults of hail,

content: 23 Which I have put aside for a time of adversity, For a day of war and battle?
content_old: 23 Which I have put aside for a time of adversity, For a day of war and battle?

content: 24 By what path is the west wind dispersed, The east wind scattered over the earth?
content_old: 24 By what path is the west wind dispersed, The east wind scattered over the earth?

content: 25 Who cut a channel for the torrents And a path for the thunderstorms,
content_old: 25 Who cut a channel for the torrents And a path for the thunderstorms,

content: 26 To rain down on uninhabited land, On the wilderness where no man is,
content_old: 26 To rain down on uninhabited land, On the wilderness where no man is,

content: 27 To saturate the desolate wasteland, And make the crop of grass sprout forth?
content_old: 27 To saturate the desolate wasteland, And make the crop of grass sprout forth?

content: 28 Does the rain have a father? Who begot the dewdrops?
content_old: 28 Does the rain have a father? Who begot the dewdrops?

content: 29 From whose belly came forth the ice? Who gave birth to the frost of heaven?
content_old: 29 From whose belly came forth the ice? Who gave birth to the frost of heaven?

content: 30 Water congeals like stone, And the surface of the deep compacts.
content_old: 30 Water congeals like stone, And the surface of the deep compacts.

content: 31 Can you tie cords to Pleiades Or undo the reins of Orion?
content_old: 31 Can you tie cords to Pleiades Or undo the reins of Orion?

content: 32 Can you lead out Mazzaroth in its season, Conduct the Bear with her sons?
content_old: 32 Can you lead out Mazzaroth in its season, Conduct the Bear with her sons?

content: 33 Do you know the laws of heaven Or impose its authority on earth?
content_old: 33 Do you know the laws of heaven Or impose its authority on earth?

content: 34 Can you send up an order to the clouds For an abundance of water to cover you?
content_old: 34 Can you send up an order to the clouds For an abundance of water to cover you?

content: 35 Can you dispatch the lightning on a mission And have it answer you, “I am ready”?
content_old: 35 Can you dispatch the lightning on a mission And have it answer you, “I am ready”?

content: 36 Who put wisdom in the hidden parts? Who gave understanding to the mind?
content_old: 36 Who put wisdom in the hidden parts? Who gave understanding to the mind?

content: 37 Who is wise enough to give an account of the heavens? Who can tilt the bottles of the sky,
content_old: 37 Who is wise enough to give an account of the heavens? Who can tilt the bottles of the sky,

content: 38 Whereupon the earth melts into a mass, And its clods stick together.
content_old: 38 Whereupon the earth melts into a mass, And its clods stick together.

content: 39 Can you hunt prey for the lion, And satisfy the appetite of the king of beasts?
content_old: 39 Can you hunt prey for the lion, And satisfy the appetite of the king of beasts?

content: 40 They crouch in their dens, Lie in ambush in their lairs.
content_old: 40 They crouch in their dens, Lie in ambush in their lairs.

content: 1 Do you know the season when the mountain goats give birth? Can you mark the time when the hinds calve?
content_old: 1 Do you know the season when the mountain goats give birth? Can you mark the time when the hinds calve?

content: 2 Can you count the months they must complete? Do you know the season they give birth,
content_old: 2 Can you count the months they must complete? Do you know the season they give birth,

content: 3 When they couch to bring forth their offspring, To deliver their young?
content_old: 3 When they couch to bring forth their offspring, To deliver their young?

content: 4 Their young are healthy; they grow up in the open; They leave and return no more.
content_old: 4 Their young are healthy; they grow up in the open; They leave and return no more.

content: 5 Who sets the wild ass free? Who loosens the bonds of the onager,
content_old: 5 Who sets the wild ass free? Who loosens the bonds of the onager,

content: 6 Whose home I have made the wilderness, The salt land his dwelling-place?
content_old: 6 Whose home I have made the wilderness, The salt land his dwelling-place?

content: 7 He scoffs at the tumult of the city, Does not hear the shouts of the driver.
content_old: 7 He scoffs at the tumult of the city, Does not hear the shouts of the driver.

content: 8 He roams the hills for his pasture; He searches for any green thing.
content_old: 8 He roams the hills for his pasture; He searches for any green thing.

content: 9 Would the wild ox agree to serve you? Would he spend the night at your crib?
content_old: 9 Would the wild ox agree to serve you? Would he spend the night at your crib?

content: 10 Can you hold the wild ox by ropes to the furrow? Would he plow up the valleys behind you?
content_old: 10 Can you hold the wild ox by ropes to the furrow? Would he plow up the valleys behind you?

content: 11 Would you rely on his great strength And leave your toil to him?
content_old: 11 Would you rely on his great strength And leave your toil to him?

content: 12 Would you trust him to bring in the seed And gather it in from your threshing floor?
content_old: 12 Would you trust him to bring in the seed And gather it in from your threshing floor?

content: 13 The wing of the ostrich beats joyously; Are her pinions and plumage like the stork’s?
content_old: 13 The wing of the ostrich beats joyously; Are her pinions and plumage like the stork’s?

content: 14 She leaves her eggs on the ground, Letting them warm in the dirt,
content_old: 14 She leaves her eggs on the ground, Letting them warm in the dirt,

content: 15 Forgetting they may be crushed underfoot, Or trampled by a wild beast.
content_old: 15 Forgetting they may be crushed underfoot, Or trampled by a wild beast.

content: 16 Her young are cruelly abandoned as if they were not hers; Her labor is in vain for lack of concern.
content_old: 16 Her young are cruelly abandoned as if they were not hers; Her labor is in vain for lack of concern.

content: 17 For God deprived her of wisdom, Gave her no share of understanding,
content_old: 17 For God deprived her of wisdom, Gave her no share of understanding,

content: 18 Else she would soar on high, Scoffing at the horse and its rider.
content_old: 18 Else she would soar on high, Scoffing at the horse and its rider.

content: 19 Do you give the horse his strength? Do you clothe his neck with a mane?
content_old: 19 Do you give the horse his strength? Do you clothe his neck with a mane?

content: 20 Do you make him quiver like locusts, His majestic snorting terror?
content_old: 20 Do you make him quiver like locusts, His majestic snorting terror?

content: 21 He paws with force, he runs with vigor, Charging into battle.
content_old: 21 He paws with force, he runs with vigor, Charging into battle.

content: 22 He scoffs at fear; he cannot be frightened; He does not recoil from the sword.
content_old: 22 He scoffs at fear; he cannot be frightened; He does not recoil from the sword.

content: 23 A quiverful of arrows whizzes by him, And the flashing spear and the javelin.
content_old: 23 A quiverful of arrows whizzes by him, And the flashing spear and the javelin.

content: 24 Trembling with excitement, he swallows the land; He does not turn aside at the blast of the trumpet.
content_old: 24 Trembling with excitement, he swallows the land; He does not turn aside at the blast of the trumpet.

content: 25 As the trumpet sounds, he says, “Aha!” From afar he smells the battle, The roaring and shouting of the officers.
content_old: 25 As the trumpet sounds, he says, “Aha!” From afar he smells the battle, The roaring and shouting of the officers.

content: 26 Is it by your wisdom that the hawk grows pinions, Spreads his wings to the south?
content_old: 26 Is it by your wisdom that the hawk grows pinions, Spreads his wings to the south?

content: 27 Does the eagle soar at your command, Building his nest high,
content_old: 27 Does the eagle soar at your command, Building his nest high,

content: 28 Dwelling in the rock, Lodging upon the fastness of a jutting rock?
content_old: 28 Dwelling in the rock, Lodging upon the fastness of a jutting rock?

content: 29 From there he spies out his food; From afar his eyes see it.
content_old: 29 From there he spies out his food; From afar his eyes see it.

content: 1 The LORD said in reply to Job.
content_old: 1 The LORD said in reply to Job.

content: 2 Shall one who should be disciplined complain against Shaddai? He who arraigns God must respond.
content_old: 2 Shall one who should be disciplined complain against Shaddai? He who arraigns God must respond.

content: 3 Job said in reply to the LORD:
content_old: 3 Job said in reply to the LORD:

content: 4 See, I am of small worth; what can I answer You? I clap my hand to my mouth.
content_old: 4 See, I am of small worth; what can I answer You? I clap my hand to my mouth.

content: 5 I have spoken once, and will not reply; Twice, and will do so no more.
content_old: 5 I have spoken once, and will not reply; Twice, and will do so no more.

content: 6 Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:
content_old: 6 Then the LORD replied to Job out of the tempest and said:

content: 7 Gird your loins like a man; I will ask, and you will inform Me.
content_old: 7 Gird your loins like a man; I will ask, and you will inform Me.

content: 8 Would you impugn My justice? Would you condemn Me that you may be right?
content_old: 8 Would you impugn My justice? Would you condemn Me that you may be right?

content: 9 Have you an arm like God’s? Can you thunder with a voice like His?
content_old: 9 Have you an arm like God’s? Can you thunder with a voice like His?

content: 10 Deck yourself now with grandeur and eminence; Clothe yourself in glory and majesty.
content_old: 10 Deck yourself now with grandeur and eminence; Clothe yourself in glory and majesty.

content: 11 Scatter wide your raging anger; See every proud man and bring him low.
content_old: 11 Scatter wide your raging anger; See every proud man and bring him low.

content: 12 See every proud man and humble him, And bring them down where they stand.
content_old: 12 See every proud man and humble him, And bring them down where they stand.

content: 13 Bury them all in the earth; Hide their faces in obscurity.
content_old: 13 Bury them all in the earth; Hide their faces in obscurity.

content: 14 Then even I would praise you For the triumph your right hand won you.
content_old: 14 Then even I would praise you For the triumph your right hand won you.

content: 15 Take now behemoth, whom I made as I did you; He eats grass, like the cattle.
content_old: 15 Take now behemoth, whom I made as I did you; He eats grass, like the cattle.

content: 16 His strength is in his loins, His might in the muscles of his belly.
content_old: 16 His strength is in his loins, His might in the muscles of his belly.

content: 17 He makes his tail stand up like a cedar; The sinews of his thighs are knit together.
content_old: 17 He makes his tail stand up like a cedar; The sinews of his thighs are knit together.

content: 18 His bones are like tubes of bronze, His limbs like iron rods.
content_old: 18 His bones are like tubes of bronze, His limbs like iron rods.

content: 19 He is the first of God’s works; Only his Maker can draw the sword against him.
content_old: 19 He is the first of God’s works; Only his Maker can draw the sword against him.

content: 20 The mountains yield him produce, Where all the beasts of the field play.
content_old: 20 The mountains yield him produce, Where all the beasts of the field play.

content: 21 He lies down beneath the lotuses, In the cover of the swamp reeds.
content_old: 21 He lies down beneath the lotuses, In the cover of the swamp reeds.

content: 22 The lotuses embower him with shade; The willows of the brook surround him.
content_old: 22 The lotuses embower him with shade; The willows of the brook surround him.

content: 23 He can restrain the river from its rushing; He is confident the stream will gush at his command.
content_old: 23 He can restrain the river from its rushing; He is confident the stream will gush at his command.

content: 24 Can he be taken by his eyes? Can his nose be pierced by hooks?
content_old: 24 Can he be taken by his eyes? Can his nose be pierced by hooks?

content: 25 Can you draw out Leviathan by a fishhook? Can you press down his tongue by a rope?
content_old: 25 Can you draw out Leviathan by a fishhook? Can you press down his tongue by a rope?

content: 26 Can you put a ring through his nose, Or pierce his jaw with a barb?
content_old: 26 Can you put a ring through his nose, Or pierce his jaw with a barb?

content: 27 Will he plead with you at length? Will he speak soft words to you?
content_old: 27 Will he plead with you at length? Will he speak soft words to you?

content: 28 Will he make an agreement with you To be taken as your lifelong slave?
content_old: 28 Will he make an agreement with you To be taken as your lifelong slave?

content: 29 Will you play with him like a bird, And tie him down for your girls?
content_old: 29 Will you play with him like a bird, And tie him down for your girls?

content: 30 Shall traders traffic in him? Will he be divided up among merchants?
content_old: 30 Shall traders traffic in him? Will he be divided up among merchants?

content: 31 Can you fill his skin with darts Or his head with fish-spears?
content_old: 31 Can you fill his skin with darts Or his head with fish-spears?

content: 1 See, any hope of capturing him must be disappointed; One is prostrated by the very sight of him.
content_old: 1 See, any hope of capturing him must be disappointed; One is prostrated by the very sight of him.

content: 2 There is no one so fierce as to rouse him; Who then can stand up to Me?
content_old: 2 There is no one so fierce as to rouse him; Who then can stand up to Me?

content: 3 Whoever confronts Me I will requite, For everything under the heavens is Mine.
content_old: 3 Whoever confronts Me I will requite, For everything under the heavens is Mine.

content: 4 I will not be silent concerning him Or the praise of his martial exploits.
content_old: 4 I will not be silent concerning him Or the praise of his martial exploits.

content: 5 Who can uncover his outer garment? Who can penetrate the folds of his jowls?
content_old: 5 Who can uncover his outer garment? Who can penetrate the folds of his jowls?

content: 6 Who can pry open the doors of his face? His bared teeth strike terror.
content_old: 6 Who can pry open the doors of his face? His bared teeth strike terror.

content: 7 His protective scales are his pride, Locked with a binding seal.
content_old: 7 His protective scales are his pride, Locked with a binding seal.

content: 8 One scale touches the other; Not even a breath can enter between them.
content_old: 8 One scale touches the other; Not even a breath can enter between them.

content: 9 Each clings to each; They are interlocked so they cannot be parted.
content_old: 9 Each clings to each; They are interlocked so they cannot be parted.

content: 10 His sneezings flash lightning, And his eyes are like the glimmerings of dawn.
content_old: 10 His sneezings flash lightning, And his eyes are like the glimmerings of dawn.

content: 11 Firebrands stream from his mouth; Fiery sparks escape.
content_old: 11 Firebrands stream from his mouth; Fiery sparks escape.

content: 12 Out of his nostrils comes smoke As from a steaming, boiling cauldron.
content_old: 12 Out of his nostrils comes smoke As from a steaming, boiling cauldron.

content: 13 His breath ignites coals; Flames blaze from his mouth.
content_old: 13 His breath ignites coals; Flames blaze from his mouth.

content: 14 Strength resides in his neck; Power leaps before him.
content_old: 14 Strength resides in his neck; Power leaps before him.

content: 15 The layers of his flesh stick together; He is as though cast hard; he does not totter.
content_old: 15 The layers of his flesh stick together; He is as though cast hard; he does not totter.

content: 16 His heart is cast hard as a stone, Hard as the nether millstone.
content_old: 16 His heart is cast hard as a stone, Hard as the nether millstone.

content: 17 Divine beings are in dread as he rears up; As he crashes down, they cringe.
content_old: 17 Divine beings are in dread as he rears up; As he crashes down, they cringe.

content: 18 No sword that overtakes him can prevail, Nor spear, nor missile, nor lance.
content_old: 18 No sword that overtakes him can prevail, Nor spear, nor missile, nor lance.

content: 19 He regards iron as straw, Bronze, as rotted wood.
content_old: 19 He regards iron as straw, Bronze, as rotted wood.

content: 20 No arrow can put him to flight; Slingstones turn into stubble for him.
content_old: 20 No arrow can put him to flight; Slingstones turn into stubble for him.

content: 21 Clubs are regarded as stubble; He scoffs at the quivering javelin.
content_old: 21 Clubs are regarded as stubble; He scoffs at the quivering javelin.

content: 22 His underpart is jagged shards; It spreads a threshing-sledge on the mud.
content_old: 22 His underpart is jagged shards; It spreads a threshing-sledge on the mud.

content: 23 He makes the depths seethe like a cauldron; He makes the sea like an ointment-pot.
content_old: 23 He makes the depths seethe like a cauldron; He makes the sea like an ointment-pot.

content: 24 His wake is a luminous path; He makes the deep seem white-haired.
content_old: 24 His wake is a luminous path; He makes the deep seem white-haired.

content: 25 There is no one on land who can dominate him, Made as he is without fear.
content_old: 25 There is no one on land who can dominate him, Made as he is without fear.

content: 1 Job said in reply to the LORD:
content_old: 1 Job said in reply to the LORD:

content: 2 I know that You can do everything, That nothing you propose is impossible for You.
content_old: 2 I know that You can do everything, That nothing you propose is impossible for You.

content: 3 Who is this who obscures counsel without knowledge? Indeed, I spoke without understanding Of things beyond me, which I did not know.
content_old: 3 Who is this who obscures counsel without knowledge? Indeed, I spoke without understanding Of things beyond me, which I did not know.

content: 4 Hear now, and I will speak; I will ask, and You will inform me.
content_old: 4 Hear now, and I will speak; I will ask, and You will inform me.

content: 5 I had heard You with my ears, But now I see You with my eyes;
content_old: 5 I had heard You with my ears, But now I see You with my eyes;

content: 6 Therefore, I recant and relent, Being but dust and ashes.
content_old: 6 Therefore, I recant and relent, Being but dust and ashes.

content: 7 After the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “I am incensed at you and your two friends, for you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.
content_old: 7 After the LORD had spoken these words to Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, “I am incensed at you and your two friends, for you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.

content: 8 Now take seven bulls and seven rams and go to My servant Job and sacrifice a burnt offering for yourselves. And let Job, My servant, pray for you; for to him I will show favor and not treat you vilely, since you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.”
content_old: 8 Now take seven bulls and seven rams and go to My servant Job and sacrifice a burnt offering for yourselves. And let Job, My servant, pray for you; for to him I will show favor and not treat you vilely, since you have not spoken the truth about Me as did My servant Job.”

content: 9 Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the LORD had told them, and the LORD showed favor to Job.
content_old: 9 Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went and did as the LORD had told them, and the LORD showed favor to Job.

content: 10 The LORD restored Job’s fortunes when he prayed on behalf of his friends, and the LORD gave Job twice what he had before.
content_old: 10 The LORD restored Job’s fortunes when he prayed on behalf of his friends, and the LORD gave Job twice what he had before.

content: 11 All his brothers and sisters and all his former friends came to him and had a meal with him in his house. They consoled and comforted him for all the misfortune that the LORD had brought upon him. Each gave him one kesitah and each one gold ring.
content_old: 11 All his brothers and sisters and all his former friends came to him and had a meal with him in his house. They consoled and comforted him for all the misfortune that the LORD had brought upon him. Each gave him one kesitah and each one gold ring.

content: 12 Thus the LORD blessed the latter years of Job’s life more than the former. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and one thousand she-asses.
content_old: 12 Thus the LORD blessed the latter years of Job’s life more than the former. He had fourteen thousand sheep, six thousand camels, one thousand yoke of oxen, and one thousand she-asses.

content: 13 He also had seven sons and three daughters.
content_old: 13 He also had seven sons and three daughters.

content: 14 The first he named Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.
content_old: 14 The first he named Jemimah, the second Keziah, and the third Keren-happuch.

content: 15 Nowhere in the land were women as beautiful as Job’s daughters to be found. Their father gave them estates together with their brothers.
content_old: 15 Nowhere in the land were women as beautiful as Job’s daughters to be found. Their father gave them estates together with their brothers.

content: 16 Afterward, Job lived one hundred and forty years to see four generations of sons and grandsons.
content_old: 16 Afterward, Job lived one hundred and forty years to see four generations of sons and grandsons.
